96257.name: New Super Mario Bros. Wii Coin World
96257.description:
User Summary

New Super Mario Bros. Wii Coin World is an arcade game in which players compete for tokens in various minigames. Featured minigames include slot machines, cannon-firing, card matching, and platforming action sequences. In the last round, players have an opportunity to defeat Bowser to win the jackpot!

96258.name: Time Spoileren (Issue 4 - Autumn 1989)
96258.description:

Convention reportand club news among new rules for boardgames.

96259.name: Time Spoileren (Issue 6 - Jun 1991)
96259.description:

120990.name: Dominant Species: The Card Game – Promo Card Set

boardgamehonor.24016: 2013 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee

96260.description:
15,000 B.C. – a great ice age is ending. Another titanic struggle for global supremacy has unwittingly commenced between the animal species.

Dominant Species: The Card Game is a fast-playing game that abstractly recreates a tiny portion of ancient history: the ponderous rescinding of an ice age and what that entails for the living creatures trying to adapt to the slowly-changing earth.

Players will use six major animal classes – mammal, reptile, bird, amphibian, arachnid or insect – to further their goals in various terrain. Through wily card play, players will strive to become dominant at as many different terrestrial and sea biomes as possible in order to claim valuable victory points: It is survival of the fittest.

All of this leads to the end game – the final descent of the ice age – where the player who has accumulated the most victory points wins the game.

But somebody better become dominant quickly because it's getting mighty warm...

Dominant Species: The Card Game consists of ten rounds of competition, each round occurring on ten of the twelve different Biome cards. The player who starts a competition must choose to either play one Action card or pass.

Action cards consist of animals played to the table as well as events. Animals contribute their Food Chain values towards gaining valuable victory points at the various Biomes, and use their element icons to fight for control of the six Element resource cards. Animals can also sometimes suppress other animals, turning them from Healthy to Endangered, or Endangered to Extinct. Event cards can be powerful one-time effects or ongoing effects that last throughout the round.
Play proceeds clockwise around the table in like fashion until every player has passed consecutively or when any one player has passed with an empty hand. At that point Element cards and the current Biome card are scored, with victorious players recording their gains on the Victory Point Track. If the competition is at a Tundra, one or more dominant players will advance one space on the Survival Track.

The current Biome card as well as all played Action cards are then discarded, and a new Biome card brought into play. Finally, each player draws (and perhaps discards) new Action cards based on his position on the Survival Track, and a new competition round begins. Play proceeds from Biome to Biome in like fashion until the game ends and a winner is determined.

Reimplements

Dominant Species
96260.name: Dominant Species: The Card Game

96261.name: Cities XL 2011
96261.description:
Imagine and Conceive cities of all types and sizes on Cities XL planet. From a several million citizens megalopolis to a hyped seaside resort, to an industrial city, everything is allowed in Cities XL 2011!

Take advantage of an incredible collection of more than 700 buildings and structures, 47 different types of maps featuring realistic environments. Enjoy never seen before freedom in a city-builder!

As a virtual mayor, find the right balance between economic development of your cities, attractiveness, transportation (road traffic, bus, metro…), pollution, social services, taxes and even leisure activities. For the first time in this kind of game, Cities XL 2011 finally let you go beyond the simple creation of a city! Connect every city that you build in a trade network, specialize some of them so that they can provide for others, thus creating a large-scale economy balance.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96262.name: Indianapolis Motor Speedway Expansion Pack
96262.description:
User Summary

One of two expansion packs for IndyCar Racing. This one adds the famous Indianapolis Motor Speedway used for the Indy 500.

Also included are utilities for creating custom car paint jobs and a replay editor.

96263.name: IndyCar Circuits Expansion Pack
96263.description:
User Summary

One of two expansion packs for IndyCar Racing. This one adds seven new tracks:


Surfer's Paradise (Queensland, Australia)
Burke Lakefront Airport (Cleveland, OH)
Belle Isle Park (Detroit, MI)
Road America (Elkhart Lake, WI)
Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course (Lexington, OH)
Phoenix International (Phoenix, AZ)
Pacific Place (Vancouver, BC, Canada)


Also included are utilities for creating custom car paint jobs and a replay editor.

96264.name: Emer Book I: Hæstra and the History of the Emerian Empire
96264.description:
Product Description:
Emer 1
This is the first in a series of new guidebooks detailing the fantastic Shadow World. The Shadow World is a fantasy world created primarily for use with the fantasy role-playing system Rolemaster published by Iron Crown Enterprises (ICE). Shadow World books are produced under license from ICE. Emer I includes: A detailed timeline, including the history of the Emerian Empire, its rise and fall as well as new information of events in the two years since the present time of Eidolon. A large section devoted to the realms of Haestra, featuring new information about Danarchis, Stroane and Sarnak, as well as previously undisclosed cities and realms: the Komaren Cluster, the Port of Izar, the secret city of the Dark Elves, and the Thesmoq Domain. Information about the Changramai Warrior-monk college, the Eight orders of the Old Empire (including their powerful artifacts), and other groups and powerful individuals. New information on secret places such as the Coral Road, the Ash Lairs, Portals, holy and unholy places, and other mysteries. Beast and NPC charts, including typical inhabitants of every region. (All stats are in Rolemaster 2nd Edition format, with easy conversion to RMSS)A full-color 11" x 17" insert with a map of Haestra for the PCs. Six maps detailing the region for the GM, with secret places, and many features not on the PC map. Four city maps: Aquitar, (Capital of the Komaren cluster), the Port of Izar, Artha (Capital of Danarchis), and Sarnak, city of the Amazons.

96265.name: Numbers Up
96265.description:
From their own description:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: The object of the game is to build high scoring number sequences cross-cube fashion with as many cubes as possible before the timer runs out. The player who exercises the greatest skill and strategy in forming and locating number combinations on the playing board to best advantage will attain the highest score.

This is the "Original Version"-(until such time yet another is discovered to refute such), that later kinds were based upon. It includes 15 six-sided dice with six-(6) varying numerals configurations upon those, to include some combination derived from the numbers between 1 to 15 upon their facile sides. There is also a "Sandtimer" attachment piece, to affix it onto a corner of the plastic GAME board/dice tray. Their "playing area" is comprised of an inset, plastic 9 X 9 grid in a "Scrabble-ish" demeanor, with *Special* placement spots denoting Double or Triple *Score*, as well with numbered sort from #4 to #15 arranged sequentially into an arrayed 'diamond pattern' 2-spots away from the center, as the middle one is their black START spot. The instructions are contained within their 'box-top', to include ample displays of numbers arrangements examples.

96266.description:
3 games innovatively using 1 deck of 54 custom cards, all set in the steampunk-themed Aether Captains game world.

Players supply 5d6 to share and 24 eurocube sized markers per player. All the games are designed to share components and be able to be played quickly by 2 players in a compact space. Deck includes all cards to play each game, cards which are the game boards, and rules. Designed for print and play fans of Aether Captains (printable on standard 8.5" x 11' paper), also available as an Artscow order.

The Games:

Intrigue (27 cards including rules): a 2 player game of area control across the city states of Arkady, using 24 eurocube style markers per player. Players take on the role of Grand Council members, vying for influence in the city states. Players use groups of matching cards to place 1-3 markers in each city state during their turns, trying for a majority, or can use cards to remove an opponent's influence. The game is played in 2 rounds, scoring each round, and takes 10-20 minutes.

Zeppelin Derby (12 cards including rules): a simple 2 player race game in the skies over Thoia. Players roll 5d6 and use cards as roll modifiers to race across a 3 card course. Cards include Dirty Tricks and Engineering bonuses. 5-10 minutes.

Celinian Trader (14 cards including rules): a pick up and deliver style game of trade on the Celinian Sea for 1 or 2 players. Needed are 14 eurocube style markers per player and 5d6. Players fill their holds with different types of goods - copper, glass, coal and linen - as they sail from port to port buying and selling goods, amassing their fortunes. The game is played over 4 rounds whose length is determined by a series of events both players are subject to. Different values for buying and selling are set by a Trade Market that changes prices from round to round. Competing for victory points, players may also purchase upgrades to their ships. This game is also suitable for solitaire play and takes 20-30 minutes.

All three games are designed to be quickly learned, easy to play and fun.
96266.name: Aether Captains: Triad

96267.name: Rin
96267.description:
Rin is an abstract board game played on a 16x16 grid. Two players, Black and White, take turns placing their own stones on the board and surrounding territory with rings. Black takes the first turn of the game. From then on, each player takes two turns in succession before the other player moves. The object of the game is to have the most territory (and hence most stones) when the board is full.

Rules:
http://blog.zmxv.com/2010/12/rin-abstract-strategy-game.html
Demo:
http://beta.appspot.com/rin/demo.html

96268.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Siege Warfare expansion set for Grunt. Adds 3D castle kit, 2 City kits, siege warfare props, advanced castle and castle siege rules, new battle cards and more.

Back of Box:

Grunt Deluxe Diege Warfare provides you with inexpensive three dimensional Castle, Cities, and Battlefield Marker kits (assembly required) and a 40 page expanded rule booklet covering all aspects of Siege Warfare. The expanded siege warfare rules add more depth to your Grunt battles and opens more strategies for players to explore. No other miniatures game offers you a complete 3D castle set and comprehensive siege rules at such an affordable price.

Purchase Grunt Deluxe Siege Warfare Expansion Boxes for additional modular castle and city kit pieces and customize your own Grunt castle to match your army's play style. Minimize your castle and expand your army or fortify your cities. Or make a huge castle and place your cities within, and stnad ready to fend off the largest of siege armies. Also check out Grunt Deluxe Siege Warfare card expansion packs to customize your Battle and Spell Card decks for siege warfare.
96268.name: Grunt Deluxe: Siege Warfare

96269.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Features these three classic GHOULASH scenarios: "Door Jam," "Maze 1" and "Moving Target"

SCENARIO: DOOR JAM

There are dozens of doors, but not all of them will allow you passage!

SCENARIO: MAZE I

Just get from one corner to the other, if the Ghouls will let you.

SCENARIO: MOVING TARGET

Battle your way to the bulls-eye of this challenging grid.
96269.name: Ghoulash: Scenario Pack 2

96270.name: Hackmaster GameMaster's Shield (Revised)
96270.description:
Back in print with updated and new material, including various class tables and additional weapon damages! This monstrous 32-panel goliath is fully adaptable and customizable to individual GMs, including dry-erase marker compatible lamination. The Shield converts between Combat Mode and Non-Combat Mode using an ingeniously engineered series of flip panels. GMs won't need to reference the PHB and GMG for a single chart during game play! Fun for the whole gaming table!

Source: Publisher

96271.name: The Broken Covenant of Calebais
96271.description:
(from the back of the book)

The Bell of Ibyn Never Tolled.

And so the covenant fell. The wondrous Bell warned the wizards of all dangers, or so the magi of Calebais thought. But fifty long years ago, some malignant force destroyed their beautiful fortress, and its opulent halls have remained untouched ever since. Until now. Into your hands has fallen a document that hints at how to pierce the protective Veil of Riddles and you have an opportunity denied to all wizards before you: to explore the covenant of Calebais, to solve its mysteries, and to loot its treasures. But how did Calebais fall, and does the danger lurk there still?

96272.name: Trouble on Widow's Peak
96272.description:
user summary

This is the Wild West Adventure 1 module called Trouble on Widow's Peak, for the Wild West RPG system. The setting is the American wild west. There are raids occurring on Widow's Peak, and cows are found dead with arrows sticking out of their lifeless bodies. The players must investigate the raids and try to solve the mystery of who is causing the raids of Widow's Peak and the Lucky Lady Mine. Once they find out who is causing the raids, then it is up to the players to stop them.

96273.name: Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents
96273.description:
From the back of the book:
Recover the Bandit Lord's Loot

A secret vault beneath the keep is rumored to contain a bandit lord's lost hoard. Gorn Hammerfall, the descendant of the bandit, along with your patron Benwick, have tasked you to recover this wealth before it is discovered by others, promising you a fair share of the take. Can you delve into the hold and recover the treasure before other forces learn of its existence?

Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents (Chapter 3) is designed for five characters of 2nd level and is the fall and winter 2010-11 season of the D&D Encounters official play program. This Dungeons & Dragons adventure includes a full-color battle map, ready-to-play encounters, and DM information on the D&D Encounters official play program.

96274.name: Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents
96274.description:
From the back of the book:
Thwart a Draconic Threat

Benwick's betrayal still stings, but you learn that he has ore nefarious plans afoot -- he means to take the Keep on the Borderlands by allying with the nearby lizardfolk tribe and a pair of black dragons. Can you save the keep, restore your honour, and bring Benwick to justice before his forces are brought to bear?

Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents (Chapter 4) is designed for five characters of 2nd level and is the fall and winter 2010-11 season of the D&D Encounters official play program. This Dungeons & Dragons adventure includes a full-color battle map, ready-to-play encounters, and DM information on the D&D Encounters official play program.

96275.name: Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents
96275.description:
From the back of the book:
Face the Serpentine Siege
The Keep on the Borderlands is assaulted by Benwick and his scaly forces, as you rally your own allies and prepare yourself for battle. Can you turn the tide and defeat Benwick and his alliance of evil before Restwall Keep is laid to waste?

Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents (Chapter 5) is designed for five characters of 3nd level and is the fall and winter 2010-11 season of the D&D Encounters official play program. This Dungeons & Dragons adventure includes a full-color battle map, ready-to-play encounters, and DM information on the D&D Encounters official play program.

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96291.name: Doraemon Darake
96291.description:
A balance game featuring everyone's favourite blue, earless robot cat.

Set up the wobbling time machine on a table or floor and then take it in turns to place one of 12 Doraemon figures onto it using the chopsticks provided. Make sure you balance carefully and don't let the Doraemons come tumbling off! Finally place the Minidora on top for victory!

The game is aimed at children but is challenging enough for daults to play, especially in lighthearted settings.

It comes with numerous play options and mini games and puzzles.

96292.name: Library Data
96292.description:
Website:
Knowledge is a Traveller’s best friend and this book is packed with life-saving articles and library data entries. Designed for easy reference of the Third Imperium, Library Data contains detailed articles from A to Z on Imperial politics, ships, worlds, hazards, alien races and wars.

For use by both referees and players.

96294.name: De Pre Historie Quiz
96294.description:
De Pre Historie Quiz is a Trivia game played with a cd containing a huge amount of music fragments en about 200 questions about music hits. The first one to complete his compact disc playboard is winner.

Every player has his own compact disc made of 8 pieces, like slices of a pie. There are 8 categories of questions and you have to get one question correct in every category to complete your compact disc and win the game.
The 8 categories are:
Music Title -> where the player must name the title of a song
Music Artist -> where the player must name the artist of a song
Music Country -> where the player must name the country of origin of the artist
Music Title + Artist -> where the player must name both title and artist of the song
Trivia Time -> where the player must know the year a certain event happened
Trivia Name -> where the player must name the main person in a certain event
Trivia Country -> where the player must name the place where a certain event happened
Trivia Name and Country -> where the player must name both the main person as the place of a certain event

There are two dice: One with the options Music or Trivia. And another one with the 4 subcategories. The dice decide what fragment/song is played and what question to answer.

96295.name: Legend of the Guardians: The owl of Ga'hoole – Circles of Strength game
96295.description:
"It's good vs. evil in this exciting game themed from the fantasy family adventure film Legend of the Guardians. The brave young Barn Owl faces off against the evil Sooty Owl."

This is a smaller, themed reimplementation of Reversi with 36 spaces rather than the usual 64. The resulting game play is faster. After all 36 disks have been played, the game is over and the player who has the most owls face up wins.

Contents Include: Game Board, 36 disks and instructions.

Re-implements:

Othello

96296.name: Politikens bog om rollespil
96296.description:
From the back of the book:

Du kan kæmpe som en ridder mod orker eller være troldmand med stor magi. Med denne bog i hånden kan du komme i gang med at spille liverollespil ude i skoven eller bordrollespil hjemme i stuen.

Bogen indeholder regler, monstre og en verden af eventyr.

'Translation:

You can fight as a knight against orcs or be a wizard with great magic. With this book you can start playing LARP in the forest or tabletop RPG in your living room.

The book contains rules, monsters and a world full of adventure.

96297.name: Rebel Times (Issue 11 - Aug 2008)
96297.description: Yet another issue of Rebel Times.

96298.name: Dan-Chi
96298.description:
Dan-Chi contains 32 dual sided playing pices and a double sided board to play 6 different games (different variants)

Contents: 8 Red-White Guard Counters
8 White-Green Guard Counters
8 Green-Black Guard Counters
8 Black-Red Guard Counters
1 Double Sided Board - Front Board (6 by 6 square grid)
- Back Board (7 by 7 square grid, with center square missing)
Rules Booklet
Overview Leaflet.

The aim of the game is to get two of your guards onto a matching pair of Chi symbols printed on the board. The first player to do so wins the round and scores points based on the symbol matched, the guards lost and the opponents guards eliminated. As pairs of symbols need capturing, if an any time a player has only one guard left they are eliminated - leading to a secondary win condition.

In each turn a player moves two guards eliminating (jumping over and removing) any opponets within reach. Chi symbols can only be occupied if capturing is not possible. There are 6 games, but as the rules (and aim) for each are identicle these seem to be more like variants rather than fully fledged games.
Due to the mechanic of capturing these games play similar to checkers but the Chi matching alters the strategy quite well.

The six games are called: Tae Kwon Do (2 Players - Front Board), Aikido (4 Players - Back Board), Kung-Fu (4 Players - Front Board), Karate (2 Players - Back Board), Judo (2 Players - Front Board) and Jujitsu (2 Players - Back Board).

The theme of the game is martial arts, however this is not crutial and seems tacked on. The identical game would work, for example, with a space theme or a roman warrior theme. As with all abstracts the theme is not that important.

Volume 1, Issue 1
July, August, September 1994

96308.description: Yet another issue of Rebel Times.

96309.name: Bingo Ball (Chart Football)
96309.description:
"This game is played in pairs and is enjoyable for 2 players as it is for 10"

A game inspired by Battleships. Each player gets a card with two football pitches marked on it. One is for 'Your score sheet", the other marked as 'Opponents score sheet". You keep your card secret at all times. Each pitch is divided up into 10 squares across and 6 squares down. The rows across are represented by the letters A to F. The columns down are marked 1 to 10. So every square can be chosen by giving a letter and a number A7 or C2, for example. The idea is to trace a line from Row F up to row A, without running into a T square which represents a tackle.

96310.description:
The Napoleon's War Series are games that give players the French Army of Napoleon against the foes of France from 1796 -1815. Each game includes battles that have their own custom game boards, plastic figures representing the infantry, artillery, and cavalry with counters representing the special units, leaders, etc. Each battle within the game is playable in 1 to 2 hours. The game uses the Hold the Line command action point (CAP) system. Also added is a new optional chit pull system that is ideal for solitaire play. The game highlights the strengths and weaknesses of the different nationalities and units, as well as the various formations of each. The second game in the series is Napoleon's War Volume II: The Gates of Moscow with custom game boards of Marengo, Austerlitz, Aspern-Essling, and Borodino.

Plastic pieces in blue, white, and green portray the French, Austrian, and Russian armies.
This game is a sequel to Napoleon's War: The 100 Days
96310.name: Napoleon's War II: The Gates of Moscow

96311.name: The 3rd Birthday
96311.description:
In the far future -

Unknown creatures suddenly appear on the planet, and begin multiplying rapidly. They feed on humans, and once their food supply is gone, they travel to the past for more. Now here they are - in the present. No one knows what they are and how they came to be. These powerful creatures are dubbed the "Twisted" because of their irregular, spiral shape. In response, the government creates a Counter Twisted Investigation team - the CTI. They declare a state of emergency and play their final card.

The Overdrive Investigation -

The CTI is allowed a special type of investigation - one that allows the changing of the past to better the present. The only candidate compatible with the system is Aya, the protagonist and a CTI special agent. She wakes up with no recollection of her past, and is tortured by nightmares. And yet, she takes the investigation head on, in an effort to find out the truth of who she really is.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96312.name: Syphon Filter: Logan's Shadow

videogamehonor.31043: 2007 Spike Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

96312.description:
Desperate. Alone. Betrayed.

Gabe Logan stands alone. They've disbanded his team. His partner is missing and accused of treason. How far will he go to find the truth? Syphon Filter®: Logan's Shadow will keep you wondering who to trust, featuring an engaging storyline, all-new combat actions and underwater missions.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96313.description:
The mini expansion of "Cannes: Stars, Scrips & Screens" introduces two additional rules for the original game:


pirate ship: allowing to show a pre-release version of a movie.
storing of tiles: allowing to store tiles in the week schedule.


The mini expansion was a give-away at the fair in Essen (probably in 2003) and contains a sheet of English rules and a wooden ship tile (both delivered in a zip-lock plastic bag).
96313.name: Cannes: Stars, Scripts and Screens – Mini Expansion

96314.name: Clue Jr.:  Pirate Treasure Hunt
96314.description:
From the back of the box: In this special edition of Clue Jr. you are on a Pirate Treasure Hunt! One of five historic pirates (Blackbeard, Captain Kidd, Black Bart, Anne Bonny or Calico Jack) has hidden their loot in the Treasure Chest. It is up to you and the Clue Jr. detectives (Captain Green, Sailor Scarlet, Navigator Plum and First Mate Peacock) to solve the case of the Pirate Treasure Hunt. Search the Pirate Ship and the Desert Island for hidden clues. When you figure out which Pirate hid what valuables in the Treasure Chest, you win!

Also include 10 educational pirate trading cards and a map showing historic sunken pirate ships and hidden treasure. Game mechanics are a re-theme of Clue Jr: The Case of the Hidden Toys.

96315.name: The Human Interface for Fantasy Roleplaying (Gold Internet Edition)

rpg.3169: Human Interface for Fantasy Role Playing

96315.description:
from the introduction:
This game was designed for both the first-time player and the veteran gamemaster who is looking for a reason to resurrect that old beloved campaign. The rules are not tied to any one particular fantasy gaming world. Instead they are applicable to any of the myriad worlds found in popular fantasy literature, films, and television series.

Everything required to run a fantasy roleplaying campaign can be found in this single book, except for paper, pencil, a handful of dice, and your imagination.

user comment:
This game is available as a free download from the publisher's website.

96317.name: Dungeon Shift
96317.description:
"You awaken in a dimly-lit room with no memory of how you came to be here. As you groggily rise to your feet, you notice a sword, a scroll, a rope, and a lock pick have been laid out next to you. Dazed and confused, you pluck the scroll off the ground, hoping it will explain things. No such luck. It appears to be a magic scroll, used for summoning a wolf spirit.

You hear a clattering behind you, and the hairs on the back of your neck prickle. You turn to see a crazed-looking goblin shuffling towards you with a rusty scimitar in its hands. Quickly, you snatch up the sword. The goblin lunges at you. You clumsily block its attack, then thrust forward and impale the foam-mouthed creature. It slumps to the ground, dead.

You have no idea how you got here or why you are here. But you have a few tools at your disposal, and you are going to find a way out."

Dungeon Shift is a print-and-play solo dungeon-crawling card game. The player begins the game with four cards from the Equipment deck and must use those cards to overcome the various challenges presented by the Rooms, Monsters, and Traps in the Obstacle deck. Cross chasms, pick locks, disarms traps, and fight monsters, all the while hoping to not run out of equipment as you try to escape from the dungeon!

Once you have drawn all the cards in the Obstacle deck, you win. You may also complete a Victory condition presented by the Obstacle cards, but be warned, these Victory conditions are extremely difficult. If you run out of Equipment or become "stuck" with no way to advance, you lose!

While expanding on the concepts of Dream Shift, Dungeon Shift is not simply a re-themed version of the first game in the Shift series. It adds introduces new concepts and further explores the potential of the Shift design space.

96319.name: Desolation: Journeys, Before & After
96319.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The 144-page softcover supplement includes new archetypes, talents, equipment values, magic items and rules to guide GMs and players through the lands of Scondera before the Apocalypse. It also includes a complete campaign consisting of eight scenarios that begin before the Night of Fire and lead characters through the Apocalypse and into the After. The core book (purchased separately) is needed to play Desolation.

96320.name: HARP: High Adventure Role Playing

rpghonor.14222: 2004 ENnie for Best Non-D20 Game - Silver Winner

96320.description:
(from the back of the book)

HARP is the cure for the role playing blahs. Are you ready for some action, excitement and adventure?! Then you're ready for High Adventure Role Playing, ICE's newest fantasy role playing system.

HARP brings you the flexibility, simplicity, and drama you crave in a quick and easy 160 pages. HARP has everything you love about fantasy role playing: flexible character creation, exciting combat, critical hits, and magic. Fast and fun, HARP will have your friends up and running with new characters and everything they need to play in about an hour.

96321.name: Action Check (Issue 1 - Jun 2000)
96321.description:
From the cover:

Inside This Issue: eight converted Gamma World creatures, Miscellaneous Mishaps: supporting cast items, Transmission, Alternity, Superheroes, creating the best GW5 character you can, and more!

96323.description:
You can now enjoy "Survive: Escape From Atlantis!" with more players!

This Mini-Expansion enables you to enjoy the great game, "Survive: Escape From Atlantis!", with 2, 3, 4, 5, or even 6 players!

In "Survive: Escape From Atlantis!", you don’t want to leave anyone behind on the sinking island of Atlantis. And now with this "5-6 Player Mini-Expansion", you don’t even need to leave your friends and family behind when playing the game! Play with up to 6 players for a bigger and even more fun game of "Survive: Escape From Atlantis!"

NOTE: You must have the base game Survive: Escape from Atlantis! to enjoy this expansion.
96323.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion

96324.name: The Riddle of Steel Quickstart Rules
96324.description:
(from the introduction)

The Quickstart Rules present a highly simplified version of The Riddle of Steel as presented in the main corebook. These rules will let you get started learning the basic mechanics of Riddle right away. However, the primary corebook provides much more in the way of rules, resources and information, including: ...

96325.name: Action Check (Issue 2 - Jul 2000)
96325.description:
User Summary:

Gamma World creatures, mutant cougars, uplifted dolphins, Alternity careers, and a free fold-up set from Gary Williams of Microtactix.

96326.name: JetFighter: The Adventure
96326.description:
Game Box Back

FLY THE DEADLY SKIES

Take your choice of an F-14 Tomcat, F-16 Fighting Falcon, or F/A-18 Hornet. State-of-the-art weaponry. Over 30 sweat-drenching missions, with hostile MiG encounters and the nightmare of Silkworm missiles homing in for the kill.

BREATHTAKING GRAPHICS

Put afterburners on your computer with the fastest, most dazzling graphics around. Watch your wings sweep back as you approach Mach speed. Or take the day off and go sightseeing! The State of California is included for your viewing pleasure.

LOADED WITH FEATURES

Realistic holographic heads-up display. A cockpit packed with avionics and multifunction displays. Full carrier landings with functional arrestor cables. With JetFighter, you've got the latest in aerial combat at your fingertips.

96327.name: Treasure Trails Bible Game
96327.description: The goal is to obtain the most Crowns upon arrival at the "Celestial City." Players fill in the words missing from Bible verses on the clue cards and move the number of spaces shown. If a player cannot supply the missing words, they flip the card over to the other side to see the answer, and then move the number of spaces shown. The game is over when all players have entered the "Celestial City" or dropped out due to bankruptcy.

96328.name: Hammerin' Hero
96328.description:
Hammerin' Hero is an arcade-style, old school, side-scrolling beat em up for PSP® (PlayStation®Portable) system. Pummel your way through 12 distinct levels, including city streets, an amusement park, a TV studio, a baseball stadium, and more.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96329.name: Bomberman Fantasy Race
96329.description:
Bomberman Fantasy World is the largest amusement station in the galaxy. It was built by Dr. Ein with the hope that it would bring peace to the universe; he is also the man who created Bomberman. Of all the events held at the Fantasy Land amusement center, the Fantasy Race, held every 4 years, is the biggest. Racers from all over compete for prizes and fame. Bomberman had received an invitiation to the 10th Anniversary Race but was reluctant to participate. However, upon finding the name Burglar among the names of the contestants, what choice does he have?

Source: The Publisher Website.

96331.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XX - Mar 2009)
96331.description:
Contents:

This is the second issue with additional information on the Ashford Valley itself, for my Labyrinth Lord Chat game. And I've got a lot more to tell you!

All about Ashford

Technology and style
Weapons and armor
Equipment and machinery
Farming and brewing
Trades and trading
Fashion and Local customs
Religion

96332.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 16 - Apr 2011)

rpgissuearticle.39985: Active Measures: Zen and the Art of Leaving the Planet

96332.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #016: April 2011

Cover: Doug Knapp

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

96333.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXI - Mar 2009)
96333.description:
Contents:

I present you the third installment of Ashford Valley information, in order to give you a better view of the setting for my previous High Bridge Road and Deep Forest Road adventures. I’m using Labyrinth Lord for the system.

Ashford continued

Of gods and men
Angwish of the sun
Death to the gods
Lamiel and his books
Lucky Tor, rolling the dice
Ministers and saints preserve us
Valley of the gods
Happy holy days
A special note on healers
Healers in terms of Labyrinth Lord

96334.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXII - Mar 2009)
96334.description:
Contents:

In this final issue of the Ashford Valley's character, I'm going to talk about races and attitudes. After this issue, I’ll be focusing on Ashford's towns.

Changes in Attitudes

Country mouse, city mouse
Ashford, shining Ashford
Tradetown, like a fire in your guts
Weary Clifton
Sooton and thuggery




Races and racial issues

Mortal men, doomed to die
Elven kings and archers
Heart of stone, the dwarf
Happy halflings
Humanoids

96335.name: Class of Heroes
96335.description:
Class of Heroes for PSP® system is a dungeon-crawling RPG in the great tradition of first-person adventures like Etrian Odyssey. Explore more than 75 levels of deadly catacombs, slay hundreds of varieties of vile monsters, master the intricate art of alchemy, and uncover over 1300 items, priceless treasures, and rare artifacts. Class is now in session.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96336.name: Castelo do Terror
96336.description:
From the box, in portuguese:
"È um castelo assustador, tem 2 andares, inúmeras dependencias horripilantes, onde vivem fantasmas, vampiros, mumias e lobisomens, todos tentando impedir que a princesa seja salva, Mas você pode salvá-la e ser o vencedor do jogo. Basta ter muita coragem"

"It´s a haunted castle, two floors and countless grim rooms where ghosts, vampires, mummies and werewoves lives. The monsters are trying to keep the princess captive, but you can save her and be the winner of the game. It´s only a courage matter."

The game is quite simple. Explore the castle and be aware of the monsters. Each monster have some weakness. Vampires are killed by wooden stake , werewolves by silver bullets, ghosts by the light of a lantern and mummies by knives.

96337.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXIII - Mar 2009)
96337.description:
Contents:

Since I've spent the last couple of issues talking about Ashford Valley's character, I figure it’s time to talk about the towns of Ashford.

Start at the very beginning

History
Ashford Proper
The Keep
Tradetown Gate
Market Square
Ford Street
Gold street and High Top
Southfield
Tanners Row and Eastbank

96338.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXIV - Mar 2009)
96338.description:
Contents:

Continuing on the Ashford Valley's towns, this issue I’ll talk about the town of Clifton and the Twisted Road along the High Cliffs.

High town

History
Clifton Proper
The Two Towers
Upper Cliffs
Caravan Stop
Old Quarter
The Warrens
Peddler's Straight and Lower Town
The Lower Towers

96339.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXV - Mar 2015)
96339.description:
Contents:

The third of the Ashford Valley's towns is Tradetown, in the Rolling Hils. A town of miners, dwarves and halfings. A rough town, but a fair one.

Metal trades

History
Tradetown Proper
Riverside
Dwarf Hold
Steel Gate
The Furnace
The Rolling Hils

96340.name: Chase the Enemy
96340.description:
The board is like a chess board but 9 x 9 instead of 8 x 8. This is really a Draughts variant. All pieces start on the black squares and cannot jump or move on to a white square.
One player is the Attack and the other the Defence.
Pieces are assigned as sea-going vessels such as a Battleship, a U-Boat and even a Sea Plane.
The object for the Attack player is to capture as many vessels as possible. The pieces are assigned a point value. The Defence tries to get as many vessels into a Harbour square, where they are safe from attack.

96342.description:
One player reads the riddle in front of the card. The other players try to guess what's happened. The answer on the back of the card is read by the storyteller. The storyteller can only answer yes/no.

Black Stories Holiday Edition is part of the Black Stories series. This time with a holiday theme.
96342.name: Black Stories: Holiday Edition

96343.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXVI - Mar 2009)
96343.description:
Contents:

Sooton is the last of the Ashford Valley towns. A seedy town, filled with thieves, thugs and skull–duggery. Who would want to go there?

The Crooked Man

History
Sooton Proper
Mud Bank
Smokey Pointe
Firebrand Keep
The Cinders
Slag Street

96344.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXVII - Mar 2009)
96344.description:
Contents:

This is the first of the Ashford town adventures and a continuation of the events that have been reported in issues #5 thru #9 (High Bridge Road adventures) and #12 thru #16 (Deep Forest Road adventures).

The Sea Sprite Tavern

Finest pub in market square
Walking wood
The investigation
That night
Broke-down manor

96345.description:
One player reads the riddle in front of the card. The other players try to guess what's happened. The answer on the back of the card is read by the storyteller. The storyteller can only answer yes/no.

Black Stories Funny Death Edition is part of the Black Stories series. This version is theme with weird murders and deaths.
96345.name: Black Stories Funny Death Edition

96346.name: Interactive Fantasy (Issue 2 - 1994)

rpgissue.8965: Interactive Fantasy: The Journal of Role-Playing and Story-Making Systems

96346.description:
the journal of role-playing and story-making systems
issue 2

Cover reads "Formerly known as Inter*Action"

Cover art by Freddie Baer

If you can dream -- and not make dreams your master
If you can think -- and not make thoughts your aim
--Rudyard Kipling

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

96347.name: Spel! (Jaargang 14, nr 3 - mrt 2011)
96347.description:
Spel!
Jaargang 14, nr 3, maart 2011
(Year 14, Issue 3, March 2011)

This issue includes promo cards for Hoogspanning (Funkenschlag/Power Grid), courtesy of 999 Games. This is the same set as Power Grid: BGG Promo Card Set.
Also included is an separate double-sided sheet that promotes gaming events and clubs in the Netherlands.

Contents:

Algemeen (General)

Voorwoord
Op bezoek bij... Paul 'Wiggy' Wade-Williams
Diverse mededelingen
Ducosimpagina
Bevriende Winkels/Colofon




Bordspellen (Board games)

Norenberc
Poseidon
Navegador
Sobek
De Vulgari Eloquentia
Word on the Street
Long Shot
Adlungland
Troyes
Asara
Automobile
Haggis
Grand Cru
Leaping Lemmings
Sporen op Tafel
7 Wonders
Famiglia




Bordwargames (Board wargames)

Beda Fomm
Hornet Leader
Marne 1918: Friedensturm




Miniaturenwargames (Miniatures wargames)

1588 and all that
Steamroller
Warhammer 8ste editie
Plastic scenery
Plastic figuren van Hät




Rollenspellen (Role-playing games)

Niet Stuk te Krijgen - Legend of the Five Rings
Mijn eerste keer
Van Kerkers & Draken - deel 7
All for One
De Anatomische Les/Den Vaderland Getrouwe




Verzamelspellen (Collectable games)

Highlander
Warlord 4th Edition
MagicMania




Note: the page count of the magazine includes the front cover (which is page 1). Articles start at page 2.

96348.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXVIII - Mar 2009)
96348.description:
Contents:

Here is a second Ashford town adventure for you, continuing from last issue.

Sewers of Ashford

Down below station
Gordon the Rat
The sewers

96349.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXIX - Mar 2009)
96349.description:
Contents:

This third Ashford town adventure has the PCs running around town, trying to find a runaway dog.

Scavenger Hunt

A prize-winning pet
Encounters in town

96350.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXX - Mar 2009)
96350.description:
Contents:

A fourth adventure in Ashford town brings some new encounters for the PCs as well as a false accusation!

Some Enchanted Evening

I drank what?!?!?
Encounters in town

96351.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXI - Mar 2009)
96351.description:
Contents:

The final Ashford town adventure has to do with a heroic rescue!

Oh Fish are you Constant to the Old Covenant?

Why are fish so smart?
What fish is worth the most?
Why did the fish cross the road?
Why is it so easy to weigh a fish?
How do you bust a fish out of jail?

96352.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXII - Mar 2009)
96352.description:
Contents:

In order to maintain my Savage Worlds street cred, here is another proposed game that I ran by the Corvis Monkey Troupe. Enjoy.

The Legendary

Dragonslayers
Wizard
Ranger
Archer
Holy warrior
Thief

96353.name: Poker Face Paul's Blackjack
96353.description:
From the back of the box:

Play the card game where the phrase "Hit me" can win you a fortune or wipe you out at the turn of a card! Poker Face Paul's Blackjack turns you loose in the gambling capitals of the world and gives you a run for your money!


House Rules let you select from 4 different casinos and 4 different ways to play. Go for the high stakes in London, Atlantic City, Downtown Las Vegas, and the Las Vegas Strip.



Place your bets and finesse your way up to the big-time tables with a $10,000 bankroll.



Special Help mode at your fingertips provides hints on rules and tactics.

96354.name: Joe Montana II: Sports Talk Football
96354.description:
From back of box:

"Montana breaks free. He's got daylight! He fires it over the middle... annnnnd... TOUCHDOWN!"

Joe's back -- now with simultaneous non-stop play-by-play announcing "Man in motion!" "San Francisco 23, New York 6!" Control the action on the field and listen to the running commentary from the broadcast booth. "He sweeps left... and he's leveled at the 42!" It's a whole new game of sound and sight.

The field zooms to a dazzling 6X close-up when the players cross the scrimmage line. You see every slamming interception, flying tackle and smash through the defensive wall! Up close and personal!

Team up with another guy -- you're the quarterback, he's the wide receiver. Call your strategy with over 50 plays in rain/snow, on grass/artificial field. Wide view shows all your receivers at once.

"He's back to pass... a beauty... FIRST DOWN!"

96355.name: Newman Haas IndyCar featuring Nigel Mansell
96355.description:
From the back of the box:

For high-performance thrills, speed toward the checkered flag in a turbo-charged, methanol-burning IndyCar YOU design! Push the limits of your screaming 750-horsepower Newman Haas race car on the world's fastest tracks! It's 16 megs of pure IndyCar intensity!

Gas-and-Go with Newman Haas pit crew!

Burn up the track in the groove and straightaway!

Turbo-charged IndyCar racing: the world's toughest tracks!

Head-to-head competition: two-player split-screen racing!

Customize your IndyCar: adjust stagger, camber, wings, and more!

96356.name: Mage Noir
96356.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 1940s began and ended with war. The war that opened the decade was fought with bombs and guns, and ended with a weapon more powerful and horrific than anything the world has seen. In the meantime, the citizens of the United States rebuild their society. The war didn't touch the country directly, as it did Europe, but the losses were palpable all the same. Millions of American men went to war, and thousands upon thousands did not return. Many that did returned changed and haunted, and the music and Hollywood glamour of the rest of the decade could not drown out those nightmares.

Would this new Fallen World have a place for mages, or had Sleepers outgrown any chance of Awakening?

This PDF includes:

A brief historical look at America in the 1940s, from a mage's perspective.
Player and Storyteller advice on chronicles set in this time period.
A Storytelling Adventure System story set in the 1940s, complete with a pre-generated cabal.
A new legacy: the Quiescent.

96357.name: ProStroke Golf
96357.description:
From the back of the case:

Be part of the world golfing action with ProStroke Golf: an immersive and faithful adaptation of the world's most challenging sport.

Craft your technique, challenge the pros, and defeat all rivals!

- Featuring: Sergio Garcia, Justin Rose, Ben Curtis, Thomas Bjorn, Colin Montgomerie, Ian Woosnam, Mark O'Meara, and Zhang Lian-Wei

- Courses from a range of spectacular locations across the globe, including The Brabazon at the Belfry and Lake Nona

- Innovative "ProStroke" controls allow you to groove your own swing - just like the Pros do!

- Course and Tournament creator, allowing you to design and develop your own courses

- Game Modes; From Match Play to Multiplayer through to training exercises and a comprehensive career mode, as well as short scorecard challenges

- Commentary from the international voices of golf: Sam Torrance, Ian Baker-Finch, and Alan Green

96359.name: WarTech: Senko no Ronde
96359.description:
From the back of the box

THE BATTLE FOR PLANETARY SUPREMACY HAS BEGUN
Metal-Crushing, Fast-Action Aerial Combat
Select from an arsenal of unique Rounder Mechs and take to the skies

User summary

A mix of a one on one fighting game with a flying shooter game. Each player controls a 'Rounder' with a variety of weapons and attack modes. Players can temporarily switch to a screen-filling "Boss Mode" mid-battle for a major firepower boost.

96360.description: This is an expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross which involves players first building track and then players may race between cities. The base game involves route building like in crayon rails and the second part of the games involves racing along player routes between cities to win prize money. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.
96360.name: Railway Rivals Map SP: Spain

96361.description:
Game day promo from April 8-10.

Deep Drone
Mechana Hero
Cost: 4 Runes

Gain 2 Runes.
Put the next construct you acquire this turn directly into play.

Honor 2
96361.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Deep Drone Promo

96362.description: This is an expansion map of India for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. The base game involves route building like in crayon rails and the second part of the games involves racing along player routes between cities to win prize money. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.
96362.name: Railway Rivals Map IN: India

96363.name: The Wilderness Alphabet
96363.description:
Website blurb:
A book of random tables and charts to serve as inspiration to a Game Master using any number of popular tabletop RPG rules. The book is organized with one set of tables for each letter of the alphabet. Each letter focuses on one type of wilderness encounter area. Check out the preview for more info!

96364.name: Wacky Races
96364.description:
User Summary

Wacky Races is a kart racing game that is based on the Wacky Races cartoon show from the late 60's. Players can choose from each of the characters from the TV show and race around a number of tracks. By completing races in first, more tracks and other options are unlocked.

96365.name: Karous
96365.description:
Karous (カラス, karasu, "raven") is a video game by Milestone Inc. intended for the Sega NAOMI. The game is a vertical scrolling shooter, similar in this fashion to Radilgy. A Dreamcast version was released in March 2007. It's the last official game released for the Dreamcast in Japan.

The weapon system is based on Radio Allergy, but it uses a unique D.F.S. bomb system.

Bombs can be used when SP gauge is full. When a bomb is activated, a barrier surrounds the player, which can damage enemies within the barrier. For the duration of bomb activation, the player is invulnerable. Enemies destroyed by the barrier provide more experience points to the player.

The player's shot, sword, shield can be upgraded by using experience items dropped from enemies, with a maximum of 100 levels. Weapon levels also act as score multipliers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Karous", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96366.name: Other Hands (Issue 15/16 - Jan 1997)
96366.description:
Previous Issue

Other Hands
Issue 15/16
January, 1997

Cover art by Quentin Westcott

Next Issue

96367.name: Other Hands (Issue 17 - Apr 1997)
96367.description:
Previous Issue

Other Hands
Issue 17
April, 1997

Cover art by Quentin Westcott

Next Issue

96368.name: Trizeal
96368.description:
User Summary

Trizeal is a Japanese vertical "shmup" arcade game developed by Triangle Service. It was released in Japanese arcades in 2004 by Taito Corporation.

The player controls a ship that has three separate forms through six levels that get progressively more difficult. Trizeal is a traditional "shmup" through and through.

96369.name: Super Street Fighter IV: 3D Edition

videogamehonor.29980: 2012 D.I.C.E. Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

96369.description:
Packed with 35 playable characters, bonus stages and cinematic Ultra combos,
Super Street Fighter® IV: 3D Edition expands the action by allowing you to fight your friends
around the world using Wi-Fi.
New to the franchise are the figurine mode, which utilizes the Street Pass feature to add a collectible meta-game, and the 3D over-the-shoulder camera option that takes fighting to new depths. For those new to the franchise, a simple mode has been added allowing players to pull off challenging moves with a single touch of the screen.


Online/Local WiFi Multiplayer - Fight your friends around the world or in the same room with the only title to utilize the full capabilities of Nintendo’s online network at launch
35 Playable Characters - Play as one of a huge array of fighters ranging from classic world warriors like Ryu, Ken, Guile and Chun Li to the newly added Hakan and Juri
Figurine Mode - The collectible meta-game features figurines of iconic characters in a brand-new addition to the Street Fighter® franchise. When passing by another 3DS owner, your chosen figurines will automatically battle via Street Pass. Next time you play the game you can view the results and collect your loot!
3D Mode - A new over-the-shoulder camera option has been added, offering an exciting new perspective on the action
Game Sharing - Play a game with a friend using the ever-popular Ryu, even when they don’t have a cartridge!
Be A Spectator * With the Spectator Mode, use your own 3DS to watch your friends battle it out live
Lite/Pro Control Modes - By utilizing a customizable touch screen interface, two new optional control schemes have been added to allow new players to pull off challenging moves with ease (Lite) and veterans to better access button combinations such as throws and three punches (Pro)


Source: The Publisher Website.

96370.name: Asphalt 3D
96370.description:
Asphalt 3D is racing as you’ve never experienced before! Full stereoscopic 3D graphics and authentically modeled licensed supercars make this the most realistic, immersive racing experience yet. In Asphalt 3D, you’ll power over 40 high-performance vehicles and race through 17 exotic locations in both career and multiplayer modes.

Rich, stereoscopic 3D graphics for the races and even the menus. Enjoy gameplay designed to take full advantage of the 3D screen as you weave between cars, drift inches from the curb and navigate menus that come right out of the screen.

Get behind the wheel of over 40 vehicles (cars and bikes) from prestigious manufacturers like Ferrari, Lamborghini, Audi and Ducati.

Engage in a variety of high-speed challenges beyond your normal race: cash attack, vigilante, high-speed chase, drift, time trail, duel and leader of the pack.

Race in 17 exciting destinations including Rio De Janeiro, Tokyo and Cape Town with varied track surfaces, shortcuts and spectacular jumps.

Up to 6 players can challenge each other locally in wireless mode.

Complete StreetPass features like Viral Ranking, Viral Ghost and StreetPass PayTable.

Comprehensive tuning options to achieve peak performance for your vehicle.

Dynamic HUD reacting to speed and steering.

Control your vehicle via the accelerometer or the analogical stick.

Use the replay feature to relive all those hair-raising moments you just experienced in your last race.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96371.name: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell 3D

videogamehonor.31757: 2004 Game Critics Best of Show Nominee

96371.description:
the USS Clarence E Walsh, U.S.’s most advanced cruiser. Through his investigation, Sam learns that the key parties who are planning to use the Masse Kernels to launch WWIII are war comrade Douglas Shetland, Displace International, and Admiral Otomo, the Third Echelon Information Self Defense Force (I-SDF) contact.

The cutting edge hardware of the new Nintendo 3DS allows Splinter Cell fans to play in immersive 3D and ability to interact with the game like nothing before.

Features:
Immersive 3D Action - Gameplay, Cinematic, Maps, HUD, Menus, Loading screens, and more are projected in stereoscopic 3D.

Optimized Controls - New button mapping with the Slide Pad and Touch Pad gives the player seamless control to equip weapons and gadgets for more effective mission executions.

Enhanced Weapons - Protagonist Sam Fisher is equipped with enhanced weapons and better gadgets to infiltrate the enemy: new fusion goggles, OCP electronic disabling device, wall mine, more add-ons for the SC-20K rifle, smoke and gas grenades.

Infiltration Evolved - Lock picking is enhanced by utilizing the new Slide Pad to mimic the realism of lock picking. Hacking has also evolved from numeric codes to solving interactive 3D puzzles.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96372.name: Combat of Giants: Dinosaurs 3D
96372.description:
Over 150 million years ago in a world dominated by Dinosaurs, natural disasters were changing earth and causing chaos. In the fight to become the top predator, only the most powerful dinosaurs could survive and had to battle the Arkosaurus, the most ferocious dinosaur species in the Jurassic world.

As a new addition to the Battle of Giants franchise, Battle of Giants Dinosaurs 3D pushes the thrill to greater heights by immersing the player in an awe-inspiring 3D Jurassic world, where the dinosaurs come to life in the most realistic environments and battle opponents as if in live combat.

Features
Dive Into A 3D Jurassic World - Roam the Jurassic world in full 3D and feel the depth of the jungle, crush trees and rocks to get special rewards. Enjoy as well a strong 3D storytelling between 2 intense fights.

Spectacular Combat - Engage in fast-paced fights with direct control over your giant creature. Perform real-time actions such as blocking, dodging, hitting and execute your new super combination attack with a unique fighting style for each dinosaur.

Creating and Customization of Your Unique Dinosaur - Choose and customize your favorite Dinosaur among 18 breeds such as T-Rex, Stegosaurus, Velociraptor, Triceratops, Ankylosaurus, and Baryonyx. With over 35 colors and patterns, your dinosaur will be more unique than ever.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96374.name: Underworld Couriers
96374.description:
Underworld Couriers is a pick-up and deliver game with a twist.

Players are couriers contracted to carry illicit goods around a map of the globe.

Using a timeline, players must plan the most effective mode of travel between pick-up point and delivery location (air, road, rail or ship). Each of these types of transport takes travels at a different speed, costs various amounts and entails certain risks (passing through customs).

Successfully completing a delivery will earn the player Notoriety and money. But be careful not to get caught or you risk a stint in jail.

The most Notorious player at the end of the game is the winner.

96375.name: Buzz!: Brain of Oz
96375.description:
Buzz!: Brain of... is the eighth title in the Buzz! series of quiz video games. The game has 21 regional variations with the game's title being changed depending upon region, but the basic concept behind the game remains the same.

The questions in Buzz!: Brain of Oz are specifically about Australian general knowledge: Wildlife, TV, Sport, and so on. The versions of the game for other countries follow the same pattern except for being slanted towards general knowledge with a connection to that specific country.

The PlayStation 3 version of the game will feature online play and will also allow access to user created questions on the My Buzz! site as well as leaderboards that rank online play.

Source: Wikipedia, "Buzz!: Brain of the World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96376.description:
Take the fight to the Pacific!

Frontline is a tactical WWII ground combat card game for 1 to 4 players. This second game in the series covers small unit action during the battle for Guadalcanal.

Each player commands a squad of 4 to 10 American or Japanese soldiers and vehicles. Each card represents one soldier or vehicle. Each unit has inherent actions each turn including moving and attacking with different modes of fire. An action card deck enhances basic actions, and provides units with spur of the moment options.

The game uses counters to illustrate vital game information such as wounds, range, ammo, command, and morale. The range system is easy to use and simulates the movement of forces on the battlefield.

Frontline can also be played solitaire using the enemy Tactic cards. These cards give general, specific, and conditional orders to the enemy troops based on the current battlefield situation.

You can create battles by purchasing your starting forces, playing pre-made scenarios, or using the balanced randomized engagement rules.

Scheduled Components:
165 Full color cards (63mm x 88mm)
1 Full color counter sheet
Rulebook (Full Color)

Complexity:
Low to Moderate
96376.name: Frontline: Guadalcanal

96377.name: Buzz!: Il Quizzone Nazionale
96377.description:
Buzz!: Brain of... is the eighth title in the Buzz! series of quiz video games. The game has 21 regional variations with the game's title being changed depending upon region, but the basic concept behind the game remains the same.

The questions in Buzz!: Il Quizzone Nazionale are specifically about Italian general knowledge: Wildlife, TV, Sport, and so on. The versions of the game for other countries follow the same pattern except for being slanted towards general knowledge with a connection to that specific country.

The PlayStation 3 version of the game will feature online play and will also allow access to user created questions on the My Buzz! site as well as leaderboards that rank online play.

Source: Wikipedia, "Buzz!: Brain of the World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96378.name: The Super Aquatic Games
96378.description:
User Summary

The game features 8 events that give a seaside spin to the usual track and field sports. The events are The 100 Metre Splash, The Hop, Skip & Jump, The Tour de Grass (Unicycling), Leap Frog, Feeding Time, Shell Shooting, Kipper Watching and The Bouncy Castle.

rpgitemversion.93721: Aquelarre: Juego de rol demoníaco medieval

96379.name: Aquelarre: Juego de rol demoníaco medieval
96379.description:
user summary

Third Edition from Aquelarre, the medieval demonic roleplaying game.
This new edition maintains all the spirit and flavor of classic. Add new mechanics to salve game situations. The book is presented in color in the style of illuminated manuscripts and books. Has been published with two different covers.

In spanish:
La tercera edición de Aquelarre, el juego de rol medieval demoniaco.
Veinte años después de su primera edición, vuelve Aquelarre más completo y documentado que nunca. Esta nueva edición mantiene todo el espíritu y sabor del Aquelarre clásico y presenta al mismo tiempo nuevas mecánicas para solventar mejor algunas situaciones de juego. Más medieval y más demoníaco que nunca, el libro se presenta en una cuidada edición a todo color imitando el estilo de los códices y libros miniados. Existen dos cubiertas diferentes del mismo libro.

Carretas repletas de cadáveres resbalan por las calles embarradas de una ciudad deshabitada. Monjes copistas escriben en silencio en frías salas de monasterio. El martillo cae una y otra vez sobre el metal al rojo en el taller del herrero. Flores de fragante olor se abren en los jardines privados de la corte. Adustos y callados soldados marchan por caminos polvorientos en busca de enemigos, sean infieles o no. Es el mundo de la Edad Media, el que conocieron nuestros antepasados, el que conformó nuestro presente.

Pero más allá de lo humano, en lo más profundo de los bosques, en la cueva más solitaria, en la celda más recóndita, en lo más oculto del corazón humano, viven las leyendas. Los demonios pisan castillos, los duendes se ocultan en la floresta, los alquimistas utilizan hechizos y las brujas ríen y ríen alrededor de la hoguera, en un claro de un bosque bañado por la luz de la luna, mientras el demonio, sentado entre ellas, levanta su cabeza de macho cabrío y te sonríe, directamente a ti, lector.

96380.name: Ball Jacks
96380.description:
User Summary

Each player controls a robot crab in a battle to grab their opponents balls with their extending claws in this futuristic sport. Each player starts with two balls on a conveyor belt behind their robo-crab. If you lose all your balls you are given a limited time to retrieve them before losing the round.

96381.name: Bandits & Basilisks
96381.description:
Author's Description:

My rules - lite (lighter than Microlite74!) old-school roleplaying system, based on 0e. Some of its features:


No character class - PCs are just adventurers;
No example spells - internet is full of them (I encourage you to drop all standard spells and switch to i.e. Ancient Vaults and Eldritch Secrets spellbook);
Only two example monsters (bandit and basilisk :D).


File will be available for free, but I'd be grateful if you buy me a drink :-)

96382.name: Lakers vs Celtics and the NBA Playoffs
96382.description:
Lakers versus Celtics and the NBA Playoffs was a video game released first in 1989 for MS-DOS-compatible PCs and later adapted for consoles when released in early 1991 for the Sega Mega Drive/Sega Genesis. The game was highly successful; it was the first game endorsed by the NBA and was the first to contain multiple NBA stars and teams in one game. As the title suggested, the game was launched due to the success of the 1980s Celtics–Lakers rivalry. Established stars you can play in the game include Larry Bird, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (only on the computer version, not the Genesis version), Magic Johnson, Michael Jordan, and Patrick Ewing.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lakers versus Celtics and the NBA Playoffs", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96383.description:
An expansion of Sport of Kings, this includes many new horses that you can train and race. There is a basic game and a Campaign game.

104 Racehorse Cards
28 Under Pressure Markers
1 N.H. Race Control Track
6 Racecards
1 Rule Book
15 Plastic Stands
4 dice (2 red, 2 white)
1 Set of 15 Racehorse figures and numbers
1 N.H. Jockey's Championship Record
1 Summary of Form for 8 Stables
1 Stables Prospects Booklet
1 N.H. Racing Programme
1 Race Requirement Card/Running Tactic Card
1 Campaign Rule Book
96383.name: The National Hunt Sport of Kings

videogame.119405: Sega Genesis Classic Collection: Gold Edition

96385.name: Crack Down

videogamecompilation.119405: Sega Genesis Classic Collection: Gold Edition

96385.description:
From the European Mega Drive box

Ben and Andy, the two top special service agents, have accepted a very dangerous assignment - The elimination of Mr K. and his Artificial Life System. Mr K. plans rid the earth of human life form using the killer robots he has created and no one but Ben and Andy can Stop him. Help them infiltrate the chillingly futuristic city, place Clystron bombs and get out before they blow.

96386.name: Donald Duck Money Bag
96386.description: Players move around the board with the help of spinner to grab money bags. Player with the most money bags wins in the end of the game.

96387.name: DJ Boy
96387.description:
User Summary

You are DJ Boy - a roller skating champ - whose girlfriend, Maria has been kidnapped by the Dark Knights. You must skate through the gang infested streets using your B-boy fighting skills in order to defeat the various gang members and their bosses to get her back. Collected coins can be used in end of level shops to buy power helps to help DJ Boy in his quest.

96388.name: Ex-Mutants
96388.description:
User Summary

Set on a post World War III earth where everyone has been mutated you play as either Shannon or Ackroyd, part of an elite team with the knowledge of how to reverse the mutations. You must battle against the forces of the evil Sluggo in order to rescue the other members of your team and save the human race.
The game is based on the comic series of the same name.

96389.name: Hexyz Force
96389.description:
Hexyz Force for PSP®(PlayStation®Portable) stands as one of the most narrative-driven portable RPGs of all-time, giving users not one, but two separate campaigns to embark upon, while boasting some of the most polished visuals and sounds found to date in a handheld RPG.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96390.name: Crashbot Derby!
96390.description:
Welcome to Crashbot Derby! In this board game, you play as one of 8 superpowered robots competing in the ultimate mechanized demolition derby! Attack your enemies with wild weapons, treacherous traps, or just by crashing into them! Don’t get sidetracked, though: the object is to cross the finish line first!

Gameplay

You're in a race with up to 5 other players; your goal is to complete 3 laps (enter a checkpoint space 6 times, essentially) first. Along the way, you may step on special spaces that will give you sparks (the "currency" of this game), cards, or allow you to activate your unique Robopower!

On your turn you may do these things:
- roll a 6-sided die 2 times
- spend sparks if you have them
- play cards if you have them
You can do these in any order. You can spend sparks
or play cards between die rolls.

Of course, racing is only part of it: the other part is fighting! You can attack your opponents with the cards in your hands , which usually represent a gizmo you can use offensively. You can also spend 3 red sparks to shoot opponents... and of course, as the name implies, you can crash into them!

Players are never eliminated from the game, they continue racing until a winner crosses the finish line!

96391.name: Kenka Bancho: Badass Rumble
96391.description:
Kenka Bancho: Badass Rumble puts players in the role of a high school student on a class trip to a historic Japanese city, and includes no shortage of fist-to-face and knee-to-gut action all in the name of pride and bragging rights. You've got seven days to make a name for yourself. How you choose to spend your time and how you manage to rise to the top is up to you!

Source: The Publisher Website.

96392.name: Ravenscar
96392.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to the complete rules booklet for the live role-play system of Ravenscar. A troubled island within a troubled world. This booklet will break down into 3 sections.


The island of Ravenscar.
The rules.
A guide to monstering.


Ravenscar is designed for simplicity, a system that is quick and easy. On a whole a simplified rules system always works a great deal better and allows more room for role-play and less time worrying about rules-play.

96393.name: 101 Dalmatians
96393.description:
Players spin the spinner and may follow 2 different paths. Longer path through Regent Park and shorter but harder path what passes Cruella de Vil's gates. There are special spaces where player advance additional spaces if he stops there.
Player must spin exact number to put him on finish and win.

96394.name: Pendulum Pool
96394.description:
Players try to get their balls to holes using a unique pendulum mechanism to strike the cue ball.
Who strikes all of his balls to holes first wins the game.

96395.name: Snow White
96395.description:
49 cards, in four suits - Diamonds, Stars, Circles and Squares. The game is inspired by the playing card game of Hearts or Black Maria. This is a trick taking game where you lose points if you 'collect' a trick containg Stars or the 3 Witch Cards. When one player has a score of 200 points against him, the game ends, and the player with the lowest score wins.

This was the first card game published by Castell. Belisha, Progress, and Speed were all part of this new range.

In 1951, the game was reissued with slightly different rules and new card illustrations, and a new name:
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

96396.name: VeggieTales: The Madame Blueberry Hunt 4 Happiness Card Game
96396.description:
The dealer shuffles the orange stuff-cards and spreads them all face down. Place the blue stuff-cards face down in a deck to the side of Madame Blueberry's pile of orange cards. The youngest player starts.

The first player draws a card from the orange pile and places it face up in front of him/her.
If a Thankful card with a heart is drawn, discard all of your stuff cards and the next player goes.
When an orange stuff card is drawn, put it in front of you. Even if it's a card you don't need.
If a salesman card is drawn with a $ sign, the player must draw 2 blue stuff cards. Place those stuff cards in front of you and discard the salesman card.
If the Madame Blueberry card is drawn, keep on drawing until you get a Thankful card. Put back all the other stuff cards, including the ones you already had.

The first player who gets four thankful cards to make a happy heart wins the game.

96398.name: It's a Goal
96398.description:
A card game with 44 cards, 22 representing the First Division and 22 representing the Second Division.
Players try to score goals by playing cards which have number on them. You add up the cards played and if they total 120 or more, a goal is scored (you have covered the distance from your goalk to your opponent's goal). There are special cards that provide interaction - Goalkeepers, Penalty Cards and Obstruction Cards.

96399.name: Gulliver's Travels
96399.description:
A movie-related game but not Disney this time. This game made use of scenes from the cartoon film by Max Fleischer at Paramount studios. Published anonymously by Pepys because they didn't want to risk losing their good-will with Disney.
44 cards, each with an illustration and a word. Players must add a card to the centre of the table in their turn. Only the word on the card added is important. It must make sense and contribute to a proper sentence. When the 7th or more card is added and a sentence is finished, the player playing the last card to the sentence takes the 'trick'.

96400.name: They're Off
96400.description: 44 cards, in sets of 6 racehorses. There are also a number of special cards (Objection to Winner, that sort of thing). When a player is dealt his hand of three cards at the start, he must place a secret bet on which horse will win the race. These bets are written down and the paper folded. A horse wins the race when one player has collected a full set of that horse's cards.

96401.name: Patrizier und Diebesbanden
96401.description:
User summary

This sourcebook serves for anyone wishing to play adventures in a city. It details all facettes of city life, from professions to buildings.
Three cities in Aventurien are described in more detail:
Riva (in the north) and the gold rush feeling there
Angbar (in the center), a solid town with guild etc.
Megbilla (in the south), a chaotic town of murderers and intrigue

96402.name: Aircraft Recognition Cards
96402.description:
A very unusual offering from Pepys. They were commisioned by the Observer Corps as an aid to help sevicemen to recognise different aircraft. There were two sets printed, one with 52 cards and a joker with silhouettes of aircraft and the cards marked with R, O, B, G (to stand for Red, Orange, Blue and Green suits). The second set was still 52 cards plus a joker but this used photographs of aircraft.
Pepys saw a marketing advantage and printed rules to use the cards as a game.
The games suggested were: Pelmanism, Snap, Banker, Happy Families, Rummy, and Clock Patience.

96403.name: Katakomben und Kavernen
96403.description:
User summary

This is sourcebook on dungeons.

Monsters, inhabitants, traps, treasure and so on are covered.

10 sample dungeons in Aventurien are given.

96404.name: Double Clutch
96404.description:
From the European Mega Drive game box

This overhead view racing game is a challenge like none other. You pick the type of racer you want to drive! After each race you buy parts to improve your car's power, acceleration, and more!

96405.name: Fighting Masters
96405.description:
This one on one beat-em-up is set against the story of a demon lord who leads an underground campaign against a 12 star galaxy to take control of it. He conquers all of the stars' rulers and makes them his slaves except for one. Taking control of this lone hero, the player battles through the enslaved rulers and into the final battle with the demon lord, Lord Valgasu, himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fighting Masters", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96406.description:
44 cards, based on the Mickey Mouse film called 'Fun and Fancy Free'. The game also included a fold-out beanstalk in the box.
Players aim to lay sequences of cards. The cards have a a letter and number symbol on them (A2, B4, and so on). If you can complete a sequence of four cards, you win the sequence. The cards played are placed on to the Beanstalk card.
96406.name: Mickey and the Beanstalk

96407.name: Leander
96407.description:
User Summary

The Princess Lucanna has been kidnapped by the evil dragon Thanatos and it is your job as a royal guard to rescue her. Traverse the 21 levels split over three worlds searching for the legendary objects that will open the portals between them. Gather money from fallen foes and upgrade your armour and weapons to help defeat the bosses at that bar your way.

The Megadrive/Genesis port was titled The Legend of Galahad/Galahad.

96408.name: Peter and the Wolf
96408.description:
44 cards telling the story of Peter and the Wolf in the Disney film "Make Mine Music".
Players have to get rid of their cards as soon as possible whilst laying down as many sequences as they can during the game.The cards are described as four character cards and eight 'reels' of five cards each.

96409.name: Tony Digerolamo's Complete Mafia for D20
96409.description:
From back of book:

"TONY DIGEROLAMO'S COMPLETE MAFIA

Compatible with the D20 system, Complete Mafia allows you to create families from 1282 all da way to da modern age.

Join a family, maintain respect and don't let yer enemies find out yer weakness. Role-play your bloodline throughout history: Defend Sicily from da French da Middle Ages, join da Renaissance's Camorra Syndicate, bootleg booze outta 20's Canada or doge da Feds in da modern era.

Mr. D includes:

- Campaign settings in Sicily and the U.S.
- Mafia historical timeline
- Mob glossary
- New weapons and vehicles
- over 16 new character classes
- Mafia resource material covering over 700 years of 'this thing of ours'.

Complete Mafia makes a great game on its own or a welcome addition to ongoing campaign setting.

Don't be stupid, play Complete Mafia. Ya would be wise not to disapoint Mr. D."

96410.description:
Players take the role of the head of an entertainment company, and in order to form an extravagant music group and compete with other players, you'll need to get hold of new talented idols! Your role also requires to find suitable working environments, hire staff, and make your idol famous. Each girl has different abilities, and you can have them work together to combine their abilities so that they can get the job done. When any player has formed a group good enough to hold a concert at the Big Dome, the game ends and the player with the most money wins.
Each turn in the card game Idol Project, a new idol is revealed and it's up to the players to ensure that she will choose their studio and not someone else's. This is done by employing staff, purchasing equipment and becoming more famous. Having idols costs money, and the players can invest in stocks to keep the money coming.
96410.name: Idol Project

96413.name: TriBond Jr.
96413.description:
From the box:

It's the cool kids' game that asks... "What do these 3 have in common?"

Answer Threezer riddles and move up, bump others backwards, or get bumped yourself! The board can be full of surprises and so can the cards, but the biggest surprise will be how much fun you can have thinking in threes!

Additional note: Differs from TriBond for Kids because the board is different. The main path appears to be longer, but there are shortcuts available.

96416.name: Just William Card Game
96416.description:
