Take command of massive Dreadnoughts and Cruisers or fast and maneuverable Interceptors and Corvettes!
Establish Outposts to gather resources and build up your Fleets!
Battle pirates and other players as you conquer new territory!
Perfect your strategy and crush anyone who tries to oppose you!

Source: The Game Website.

96040.name: Dark Oak
96040.description:
From the publisher's website:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible GM’S RESOURCE adventure for 5th-level PCs by Creighton Broadhurst and Steve Hood

Beneath the fetid roots of a noisome swamp linger the pathetic remnants of a once proud and noble tribe. Laid low by a powerful narcotic administered by their ambitious (but wildly paranoid) mistress, the lizardfolk of the Dark Oak are but a shadow of their former greatness. Now below the slumbering body of a diseased treant she plots to bring bloody slaughter to the folk of the nearby villages before her followers forget their proud heritage and sink into a lethargy from which there is no escape.

96041.name: Gradius II
96041.description:
Gradius II: Gofer no Yabō, lit. "Gradius II: The Ambition of Gofer") is a horizontally-scrolling shooter originally released for the arcades in Japan in 1988. It is the sequel to original Gradius and was succeeded by Gradius III. Ports of Gradius II were released for the Family Computer, PC Engine, and X68000 in Japan. The original arcade version is also included in the Gradius Deluxe Pack compilation for the PlayStation and Sega Saturn and in Gradius Collection for the PlayStation Portable. The Famicom and PC Engine versions were re-released for the Wii Virtual Console in 2007.

No version of Gradius II was released in North America until its inclusion in the Gradius Collection in 2006. The Virtual Console re-release of the Famicom and PC Engine ports were released internationally as well. In Europe, Gradius II was released for the arcades under the title of Vulcan Venture.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gradius II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96042.name: Flip Six
96042.description:
Despite the name of the game being Flip Six, no player is guaranteed to flip six cards while playing. Instead that's only one of the ways for the round to end.

In more detail, at the start of each round each player is dealt six cards and places them in two rows of three cards without looking at the cards. On a player's first turn, he first flips two cards face-up – one on the top row, the other on the bottom – then takes his turn, drawing the top card of either the discard pile or the deck. The player then either:


Replaces one of the cards in his array with the newly drawn card, placing the new card face-up and placing the replaced card on the discard pile.
Discards the card he drew.
Places the card on a matching face-up card in his array, then discards both of these cards, then the card either above or below this position.


The goal of Flip Six is to have the lowest total when the round ends, and the round ends when a player has six face-up cards, a player has no cards (due to discarding) or a player calls for the end of the round because she thinks she has the lowest score; in all cases, each other player takes one final turn.

Players then tally their scores, which can be negative due to the deck including negative numbers. If the player who ended the round doesn't have the lowest score, that player's score for the round is doubled. The player with the lowest score after ten rounds wins.

96043.name: Super Bust-a-Move 2
96043.description:
User Summary

Super Bust-a-Move 2 is a puzzle game in the Puzzle Bobble series. Like previous games, players need to clear the screen of bubbles before they reach the bottom of the screen. Bubbles are removed by creating sets of 3 or more like-coloured bubbles using the launcher.

There are two main game modes: classic and duel. Classic mode has players attempt a series of challenging bubble arrangements solo, while duel mode pits them against either a CPU or human opponent in head-to-head competition. Super Bust-a-Move 2 features a number of special bubbles that perform differently than normal. Some blow up all the bubbles around them, while others paint existing bubbles new colours.

96044.name: FlashWordz
96044.description:
Players in FlashWordz need to create words quickly by mooching letter cards from one of their opponents and combining the letters with cards from their own hand.

At the start of the game, each player receives six double-sided letter cards from the 100-card deck and places the cards on their rack. On a turn, a non-active player starts the timer, then the active player races to create a word using at least one of the letters facing him on his rack and at least one letter facing out from an opponent. Words must be at least four letters long, and a player cannot use letters from more than one opponent.

If a player calls out a word before time expires (and the word is valid), then the player scores the letter cards used in the word, leaving those particular letters face up. If a player uses all six letters in his rack or an opponent's rack, then he takes another turn (after players refill their racks to six cards). If a player fails to call out a word, the first non-active player to grab the "flash round" token from the center of the table creates a word and scores it.

When the card deck runs out and no one can create any more words, the game ends. Players sum the letters they used in words (with wild cards being worth zero points), then subtract the point value for letters that remain in their racks. The player with the highest score wins.

96045.name: Puzzle Bobble VS
96045.description:
User Summary

Puzzle Bobble VS is a title for the N-Gage in the classic Bust-a-Move series. Players need to clear the screen of bubble before they reach the bottom – creating sets of 3 or more like-coloured bubbles using the launcher will erase the set.

96046.name: Puzzle Bobble Pocket
96046.description:
User Summary

Puzzle Bobble Pocket is a puzzle game in the Puzzle Bobble series. The game requires players to shoot coloured bubbles at the ceiling to remove existing bubbles before they reach the bottom of the play area. Completing sets of 3 or more like-coloured bubbles will eliminate the set.

96047.name: Suzerain: Mortal Realms
96047.description:
from the back of the book

The End Times Approach.

The universe is dying. A cry goes out to save mankind from ultimate destruction.

At last, the call is answered. Old religions form anew. Long forgotten deities are reborn. The Universe must be saved.

This is the End Times. the gods have returned, from Zeus the Olympian sky god to Odin to[sic] one-eyed king of the Norse gods, from Quetzalcoatl the serpent god of the Aztecs to Ra the falcon-headed Egyptian sun god.

Now you must join them and fight to save the Mortal Realms we live in. Go on great quests in ancient Greece, explore the lost temples of the Incas, or war with Vikings in their ancient worlds.

Alternatively, travel through other historical or futuristic places, treading the foggy streets of Victorian London one day and the colonies of science fiction Mars the next.

You are from a new generation of heroes willing to do the god's bidding, wherever that may take you.

The limitless world of Suzerain awaits you.

96048.name: Alan Wake: The Signal
96048.description:
Continuing from the end of the main game, Alan finds himself in a surreal version of Bright Falls. Zane directs Alan to follow a signal through a cell phone in order to focus and guide himself out of the Dark Place.

Source: Wikipedia, "Alan Wake", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96049.name: Alan Wake: The Writer
96049.description:
User Summary:

"The Writer" is the second downloadable episode for Alan Wake. Its story directly continues from the cliffhanger ending of Alan Wake: The Signal; Alan continues to fight his way through the increasingly surreal and muddled landscape of the Dark Place, tormented by televisions that blare psychotic ramblings with his voice. Accompanied by an illusionary friend and increasingly depending on the "words become reality" mechanics used in "The Signal," Alan fights to make his way to the cabin at the heart of the Dark Place and find a way to escape.

96050.name: My Little Panzer
96050.description:
My Little Panzer is included in issue #18 of the Dork Tower comic book. The background is that Ken (one of the characters) and the rest of his wargaming club have fallen asleep and are sharing a dream. In the dream, they are in the French countryside with cute little versions of World War II tanks running around shooting at things.

Each player controls a wargamer who is trying to collect as many cute tanks as possible. The tanks are controlled by the player to the right of the active player, and can shoot at wargamers or at other tanks. The game ends when a wargamer collects one of every type of tank or when the wargamers wake up.

Optional rules allow for a campaign game, a mecha unit (the PanzerKampfer), and a version in which the players control the tanks and are actively trying to shoot everyone else.

96051.description:
Dork Tower Dealers' Doom is an insert in issue #7 of the Dork Tower comic book. The game board depicts a game convention's dealers' room (in 3-D, if the provided booth backdrops are mounted and placed on the board). The players move around the board and attempt to purchase new games. Games can be taken from players by Game Zombies or Gilly the Perky Goth. This can be prevented by leaving the room to stow purchases, but this of course takes time.

At the end of the game, the value of each game is determined randomly, but the games are divided into tiers so that there is some predictability: third-tier games are generally worth less than second-tier games, which in turn are probably worth less than the one first-tier game, but there are bonus die roll possibilities, so that will not always be the case. Furthermore, the first-tier game has a very small chance of being a total bust which causes anyone owning it to lose the game.
96051.name: Dork Tower Dealers' Doom

96052.name: Nemesis: A Perfect World
96052.description:
From the back of the book:

Your friends are dead, your family is missing and the only thing standing between you and the angry mob; is a body that can lift a ton, run at 100mph and fire bolts of living flame. Welcome to the world after the end of the world. Don't be afraid...

...Be relentless

Nemesis; A Perfect World answers the age old question, "What would you do with superpowers?". Players create characters based on themselves. Blessed or cursed with fantastic powers and abilities, living in a realistic world full of deception; this time the fate of the world dosen't[sic] depend on strange visitors from other worlds, mutants, or dark detectives...it depends on you.

96053.name: Moganville
96053.description:
Website blurb:
Moganville is a well documented community that can be inserted into any current AD&D game. Includes maps, descriptions of area and prominent people of the district.

User summary:
This Dragonsfoot supplement is freely available from Dragonsfoot.org

96054.name: The Temple of Diancecht
96054.description:
Website blurb:
Send your characters on a trip to the Temple Diancecht in this great adventure with a mystery to solve and holy items to gather. This is the first adventure contributed by Lawrence Mead and Edward Winter and it's well worth downloading and playing.

User summary:
This Dragonsfoot supplement is available as a free download from Dragonsfoot.org

96055.name: Dungeons & Dice
96055.description:
Dungeons & Dice is a fantasy board game for 1-4 people.

Dungeons & Dice takes you on a journey through magical lands.
Each turn will see your hero advancing, battling, hiring NPCs, gaining Objects and Spells necessary to defeat the RED Dragon.

BASIC GAME CONTENTS:

- Up to 4 Players can play a game of Dungeons & Dice
- 4 Character's Classes
(Fighter, Paladin, Wizard, Cleric)
- 1 Game Board (4 Regions)
(The Middle land, The Desert, The Marsh, The Dragon Lair)
- More than 100 Adventure Events
- More than 30 Objects, including 8 Unique Objects
- 12 Types of Spell
- 99 STR/DEX/INT/WIS/CON/CHA Counters
- 20 Types of Monster
- 12 Types of Spirit
- 17 NPCs (Followers)
- Alignment
- Dual-Dice System
- PK (Player Killing) System
- Tutorial & Rulebook
- 3D Dice x 3 (all D6)
- a variety of Sound Effects.
- Play with your Family/Friend using Pass 'n' Play Multiplayer
- You can listen to your own iPhone/iPod music or play in-game music.

Source: The Developer Website.

Note: This game is a clone of Talisman.

96056.name: Other Hands (Issue 12 - Jan 1996)

rpgissuearticle.41787: Aggressiveness and Morale for Non-player Characters

96056.description:
Previous Issue

Other Hands
Issue 12
January, 1996

Cover art by Sophia Caramagno, Patrick Wynne, and Jeff Hatch

Next Issue

96057.name: WarFlow
96057.description:
WarFlow is a RTS war game where you can command your forces and team up with your friends to give enemies a bloodbath as well as seize their farms and mines. 100% free and no downloads required.

Source: The Publisher Website.

96058.name: Beyond the Veil
96058.description:
Website blurb:
A savaged supplement focusing on Psionics and the Supernatural in Savage Worlds RPG.

from the author's introduction:
In keeping with the feel of the modern horror genre, you'll find that the offensive psychic powers, as given in the Savage Worlds rulebook, have been dropped. There are a few powers that will help you against mundane opponents, but they've only been included to help you along until the main event -- taking on supernatural foes. Some of these you'll defeat, some you won't; you'll often find that getting out alive is victory enough!

... all the new powers presented here are Novice level. Given the restrictions of Arcane Background: Psionics, this just made sense; these types of characters are born with one or two gifts, and that's all they ever learn; however, it's not impossible to hone one's abilities or learn additional powers -- it's just not that easy!

User comment:
This supplement is available as a free download from Dragonsfoot.org

96059.name: Mercator
96059.description:
User summary:
Mercator is a historical role-playing game adapted from the Classic Traveller rules. It provides modified rules to adapt the science fiction game into a game based on Ancient Rome.

Author's introduction:
Although Traveller concerns itself with interstellar travel, piracy, misadventure and dubious heroics along the starlanes, it is at its heart a simple generic system. It has to be, to cover tech levels ranging from stone age to an era of floating cities.

It is the game's unique trade and travel system, however, that is its real strength. Transferred to Earth's ancient world, Traveller should prove successful, capturing the spirit of sea travel, haggling dockside at Caesarea instead of Glisten, fleeing from customs boats off of Corinth instead of Rhylanor. Traders in the Roman empire criss-crossed the Mediterranean, keeping the imperial economy alive and thriving, middlemen, sailors, chancers, veterans all trying to make an almost honest living.

Mercator is, then, an attempt to transport Traveller's ethos and game systems almost directly to the Roman Empire in the 1st and 2nd centuries AD. The Third Imperium becomes the Roman Empire, Regina becomes Alexandria, and goods like dried fruits or fish sauce are traded instead of machine parts or radioactives.

Many of the plots, stories and adventure hooks written for interstellar Traveller still work handsomely for a Roman campaign. Scams, smuggling, theft, ambush, raids, piracy and so forth translate easily between universes.

This shouldn't be taken as an accurate historical RPG version of imperial Rome, but it isn't a magical fantasy, either. Mercator is supposed to be a game of adventure, and the Roman Empire is a well known and familiar world full of tropes, adventure seeds and above all inspiration!

User comment:
The game is available as a free download from the Freelance Traveller website. It requires Traveller (Classic) Books 1,2,3,4 & 5 and Supplement 4. The modified rules are defined in the Mercator book but the game mechanics are borrowed from Traveller.

96060.name: Kanzler-Schlacht
96060.description:
Goal: Become cancellor (or prime minister) collecting the majority of all votes

Each Player represents an election campaign manager of a political party.
Phase I During 10 ballots you try to win as many votes/seats as possible using a set of cards, once more drawn at the beginning of each ballot.
Phase 2 The final round represents the election of the cancellor.
A First all players may try to form coalitions - for max. 5 min. Players get a new set of socalled impact-cards;
B Each player declares in public, which of the candidates should get his votes.
C Thereafter impact-cards are played - as strongful modifieers.
D Evaluate the victorious parties

96061.description:
Jours de Gloire Campagne is a game series designed to simulate the great Napoleonic campaigns, at the operational level and at that of the Army Corps. The rules are deliberately simple, because of the scale and with the aim of giving the players the wherewithal for relatively short and fluid games.

The campaign of 1813 is the theme chosen for the revival of the Jours de Gloire Campaign series (Vae Victis n°41, n°47 and n°52), whose rules have been upgraded to a Version 2.0 for this. occasion.

This game has 5 scenarios, focusing on the Germany campaigns of 1813 :
Scenario 1: Waiting For the Emperor (March and April 1813)
Scenario 2: From Lützen to Bautzen (April and May 1813)
Scenario 3: The Spring Campaign (March to May 1813)
Scenario 4: The Campaign of Leipzig (September to October 1813
Scenario 5: The German Campaign (February to November 1813)

There are also specific and optional rules or "what-if ?" situations for each scenarios.

The game includes one map (size A1 : 84cm * 59cm - 33in * 23.5in), 216 die-cut counters, a booklet containing rules and scenarios, player aids and 24 playing cards.

Historical context: After the disaster of the Russian campaign, the debris of the Grande Armée had abandoned Berlin and retired behind the left bank of the Elbe. Napoléon was able to reconstitute an army of 300,000 men by summoning to the colors those young soldiers who soon came to be called by the name « Marie-Louise ». Europe formed a coalition against France: Prussia and Russia wanted to crush Napoléon permanently. Despite his victories during the spring and summer, Austria soon joined the side of the Empire’s enemies. Gigantic maneuvers and great battles followed one after the other within the triangle formed by Berlin, Leipzig and Dresden. Whereas his victories were no longer decisive, Napoléon knew now that a single defeat could pull down his Empire !
96061.name: Jours de Gloire Campagne IV: Allemagne 1813, de Lützen à Leipzig

96062.name: The Curse of Frankenstein
96062.description:
The Curse Of Frankenstein is a game book in the Horror Classics series.

This is a fairly typical move from one paragraph to the other game book. The book uses a sanitized version of the original story, and follows up from the monsters escape into the Arctic wastes. When the game opens we have the Monster fleeing to the icy wastelands of the Arctic, leaving a trail of bodies in his wake. Dr Frankenstein is in hot pursuit. You have a choice here to play as either the Monster or the Baron, which means there are actually two campaigns in this game book.

The Monster carries with him spare body parts that, when used to replace worn ones, function as healing potions. He also has two skills that increase his damage and combat durability as well as a skill called Love Affair that allows him on a successful roll of the die to befriend 50% of his opponents and avoid fighting with them.

The Baron, meanwhile, has a skill that increases his defence, one that allows him to create a smaller version of the monster to fight alongside him, and a skill that randomly generates beneficial or dire effects depending on the roll of a die. The last skill can cause some really devastating damage on the opponent.

The Monster and the Baron are equally sturdy - they both have 100 Life Points at the start of their respective campaigns.

96063.name: Die neuen Eroberer
96063.description:
Goal: Be the first to dominate the market (gain more than 50%)

1. Players start with 20 chips (used as markers) and 15.000 money units, acting by turns
2. Your company is busy launching new products into the market; move your token by rolling the die; depending on the area you enter you may
A Collect information (card), the more the better, but with increasing costs (buy)
B Draw a 'chance'-card
3. If you think that you have enough information about a special product you want to launch you may announce to do so - tempting your fate: the higher the amount (=percentage) of knowledge you have the better your chance to score (=placing chips to dominate); otherwise you obtain a penalty
4 Games ends with domination or bankruptcy of a player

96064.description:
Midnight Men is a highly thematic cooperative superhero game where players use their personal decks of Power Cards to neutralize the threats and plots initiated throughout the city by a Villain. The players must work together to stop the Villain before his/her Master Plot succeeds, or before the Terror level becomes unacceptably high.

Hand, deck, and risk management are key aspects of game play. The heroes each have a unique starting deck of 15 Special or Super Power cards, the latter of which come in three levels of increasing potency. These cards are used by the players to act during the game - mainly to neutralize Threat cards by matching the symbols found on them with the symbols on their Power cards. Throughout the game, the players can upgrade their Super Powers (and unlock new ones) through the use of Valour Points accumulated by facing threats and neutralizing plots.







Midnight Men est un jeu coopératif de super-héros hautement thématique aucours duquel les joueurs utilisent leurs "decks" personnels de cartes Pouvoirs pour neutraliser les menaces et complots initiés partout dans la ville par le Vilain. Les joueurs doivent oeuvrer ensemble pour vaincre le Vilain avant que son complot ne réussisse, ou avant que le niveau de terreur devienne extrême.

La gestion de cartes et du risque sont les aspects clés du jeu. Les héros ont chacun un paquet unique de 15 cartes de Pouvoirs Spéciaux ou Super Pouvoirs. Ces derniers viennent en trois niveaux de puissance croissante. Ces cartes sont utilisées par les joueurs et permettent principalement de neutraliser les cartes Menace en jumelant les symboles qui s'y trouvent avec les symboles sur leurs cartes. Pendant la partie, les joueurs peuvent améliorer leurs Super Pouvoirs (et éventuellement en découvrir de nouveaux) en utilisant les points de Valeur qu'ils auront accumulés en faisant face à des menaces ou en neutralisant des complots.
96064.name: Midnight Men

boardgamefamily.4705: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

96065.name: 18ES Caminos de Hierro
96065.description:
18ES Caminos de Hierro (Paths of Steel) is a game of the 18xx family based on the spanish railways in the 19th century.
As other 18xx games, there are two main elements. A map where the players build railways and create routes, and a stock chart where users buy and sell shares.
Players can buy shares in several companies, a company is not associated with one player, but only the director of each company (the player with the most shares) operates the company (build rails, stations, and buy trains).
18ES has several mechanics not present in other games of the series, as build contracts, and company takeovers.
The game finish when the national Railway company R.E.N.F.E. is formed and take over the rest of the companies.

96066.name: Welthandel
96066.description:
Goal: Be the richest merchant at that moment, when all players have reached their home port

1. Each player starts with 10 cargo cards and 2.000 money units
2. Make money by choosing a route which allows you to sell your goods as profitable as possible - look for those ports where your cargo is looked for
3. Try to be the first to enter a port, because only the first can pick up new cargo
4. Try to avoid too many difficulties on your way (storm, mist...)
5. Sell as many goods as possible to avoid penalties

If you are the first to reach your homeport you will get a bonus.

96067.name: Zombie Farm
96067.description:
Zombie farm is a unique farming game where you can relax while you plant seeds or plant zombies! Pick up your plow and enjoy the undead countryside!

Source: The Developer Website.

96068.name: A Moon for the Sky
96068.description:
At each new millennium, Astrolunia sees its Moon die and loses the balance of its world. To predict this phenomenon, the people band together to send a new moon in the sky that will restore the ecosystem.

Help the residents and send your Moon as high as possible! During your ascent, you will be hindered by various obstacles.

A Moon For The Sky has a simple gameplay: Draw a line and that's all

Progressive difficulty through 18 levels, 8 types of obstacles and 5 Bonus / Malus.

Customize your Moon and join the Endless Mode to challenge friends and the whole world by raising your Moon as high as possible.

Will you manage to unlock every level, winning all the medals and unlocking all achievements in the game?

Source: The Developer Website.

96069.name: Premiere: Wir gehen ins Konzert
96069.description:
Goal: Be the first who gains 6 victory points by guessing right questions out of the world of music. You must cross the board from entrance to a front seat, discovering some hurdles and obstacles, but not your physical condition clears the way - compete with the others with music-knowledge and a quick response

The players can act as teams or all by themselves

1st Pick up a CD-player and insert appropiate CD (choose agreed musical genre)
2nd Each player moves his token by turns, rolling the die - depending on the color of the reached array
A You must answer a question from a quiz card
B Draw a 'chance'-card
C Solve a sound clip
You may collect a victory point, if you find the right answer; number of points to win depends
on quantity of participants; you must reach the target, too (Pachisi-like) to finish and win. There may be some nasty 'teammates' whose lack of music-knowledge can be compensated only by knocking your token once again.

96070.name: Max Adventure
96070.description:
User Summary

All of the parents in the neighborhood have been abducted by invading aliens! Join Max as he takes up a colander and ray guns to save his parents and friends.

96071.name: Joel of the Island Men
96071.description:
Throughout the galaxy, mankind drifts alone, surviving within self-contained space stations known as Islands. They dedicate their lives to trying to build the most magnificent Island in order to impress the mysterious and alluring ‘Angels’ who are believed to offer eternal life, rebirth and all one could desire.

Life on the islands is hard, mining asteroids for ore to refine in hot furnaces to increase the power and prestige of their Islands. The presence of weapons is known to anger the Angels, but some Islands develop them regardless, seeking to increase mining production, for defence, or for attacking their rivals.

When the Angels arrive, their whims are capricious. Sometimes they merely observe, sometimes they attack. Only the most magnificent Island in the eyes of the Angels will be chosen to be visited by them.

INTRODUCTION
A game for one to three players who must navigate through space, looking for asteroids to mine in order to obtain the ore needed to build and improve their Island. They must avoid deadly asteroid collisions and the aggression of their rivals as they await the coming of the Angels, bringing with them the promise of eternal peace and the threat of destruction. The winner has the greatest island (decided by points) at the end of the game.

GAME PLAY
Each player controls an 'island' a fully self-sufficent space station. Players must move through the asteroid dense area of space on the board, destroy asteroids and then collectthe shattered remnants. This can then be refined to create pure ore, and the different ores can be used to create different additional sections of the island, or repair damaged ones.

Needless to say, eventually the islands will come into conflict with each other.

The game's length is determined by the appearences of the mysterious angel-ships, players do no know how long the game is going to last exactly (20-45 minutes on average) and so must judge wen to build offensive weaponry (which score negative at the end), and when to capitalise on point scoring with certain sections (such as more luxurious living quarters and armour) nearer the end of the game.

The angels appear throughout the game, often dealing death and destruction to the island sections. The final angel's appearence ends the game, points are scored, and one player wins, becoming the chosen recpient of the angel's love.

96072.name: Grappler I
96072.description: Grappler I is a strategy based Greco Roman wrestling game with high school and college variants. Each player, using a set of 20 Outcome Sheets (cards) for "Home" (green) and "Visitor" (red), determine the results of takedowns, reverses, escapes, and controls by rolling his/her five D6s. As points are awarded, players track the match using a separate "time" scoring pad. Each game can be ran as a team match or a tournament for individual weight classes.

96073.name: NBA Hangtime
96073.description:
"NBA Hangtime is a basketball video game developed by Midway and released in arcades in 1996. Home versions followed for Nintendo 64, PlayStation, Mega Drive/Genesis, Super NES, and Windows. A version for Game.com was cancelled.

Hangtime was the third basketball game by the original development team behind the NBA Jam series. The title was changed due to the NBA Jam name being acquired by Acclaim Entertainment—the publisher of the games for the home market. New features of the series included character creation, alley oops and double dunks. A software update known as NBA Maximum Hangtime was released for the arcades later in the life cycle.

The next NBA title to be released for video game systems from Midway was NBA Showtime."

Source: Wikipedia, "NBA Hangtime", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96074.name: Crazyhouse
96074.description:
Crazyhouse is a chess variant very similar to bughouse chess, but with only two players. It effectively incorporates a rule in shogi (Japanese chess), in which a player can introduce a captured piece back to the board as his own.

* A captured piece reverses color (useful to have 2 sets on hand for this variant) and goes to the capturing player's 'reserve', or 'pocket'. At any time, instead of making a move with a piece on a board, a player can 'drop' a piece, in his reserve, onto an empty square on the board.
* Promoted but captured pawns are dropped as pawns.
* Pawns must not be dropped on the 1st or 8th ranks.
* Drops which cause immediate checkmate are allowed. Unlike in shogi, this includes pawn drops.
* A check that would cause checkmate, in regular chess, can be answered if the defender can make a legal drop which blocks the check.

96075.name: Variété Paris
96075.description:
Goal: Manage your 'emerging' artistic skills to describe/paint/pantomime/poetize terms within a given time - if successful collect chips (baguettes, cheese, bottle of red wine, glass of champagne); game ends after one player has build up a complete dinner.

1 Rolling a six-sided die with icons players move their tokens by turns onto the appropriate next located area.
2 The icon shows the type of requested performance; a second die predicts the number/term on the actual item-card player must illustrate
3 Within a minute term should be guessed by one of the players - both be rewarded depending on difficulty with several chips
Easy to understand that - if you are in a 'Variété' - sometimes terms can be a bit saucy, which is intended by designers self-evidently (see minimum age); because of the different values of the chips (swap meet advantages alcohol, especially champagne) a lot of baguettes will pass through your fingers until game ends

96076.name: Wrath of the Volcano God!
96076.description:
INTRODUCTION
The timeless distant mist-shrouded isle of Aya-ooya! is marked on no maps, and its location is known to but a few neighbouring island peoples. To them it is simply known as ‘The Isle of the Volcano God’ .

On Aya-ooya! The people live, as they have done since time began, in perfect (if somewhat perilous) harmony with their environment. There are six main tribes on the island, each with their own land and traditions, and all competing for the resources and the respect of the Volcano God.

Players on their turn must tend to their needs of their tribe, as well as paying appropriate homage to the Volcano God. The winner shall be the player who’s tribe escapes most unscathed from the apocalyptic ‘Wrath of the Volcano God!’

THE ISLE OF THE VOLCANO GOD
The board represents Aya-ooya! also known as The Isle of the Volcano God which is separated into six numbered segments, know as lands.

Each land (from edge to centre) consists of shore, light forest, deep forest, lower, mid and upper mountain slopes and terminates at the Mouth of the Volcano God. The borderlands, exist in two lands simultaneously.

Also printed on the board is the Heart of the Volcano God where unclaimed lava tokens accumulate and the wheel of sacrifice, where sacrifices are recorded for each tribe.

96079.name: Prophet's Shroud
96079.description:
User Summary:

Three panel GM screen bundled with introductory adventure "Reward of the Wicked."

96080.description:
This adventure source pack is intended to create an ongoing campaign for the High Adventure Cliffhanger: The Buck Rogers Adventure Game rules.

The War for Freedom Continues! Deep within the Grand Canyon lies a secret Han airbase. Hidden here is an irresistible super-weapon that will bring the rebellion to its knees. The only defense is for a small band of heroes to infiltrate the base and foil the plot before final disaster strikes! Armed with the best available weapons, and allied with both native American freedom fighters and the mysterious Golden Dragon Society, the heroes must attempt to stop the unstoppable.

This boxed campaign set expansion includes the following:


A 32 page full-color World at War book, which expands the world giving loads of information on new technologies, new places, and the people of the 25th Century.



A 48 page, full-color Campaigns vs. the Han book, which shows GM's how to construct campaigns, giving expanded tables for quick creation of adventures and gaming sessions. It also has a great adventure that pits the player characters against the Mongol Overlords.



2 full-color, poster-size maps put the 25th Century on your gaming table, including a large-scale playing map of a Han airship.



Lots of stand-up counters and terrain tiles.
96080.name: High Adventure Cliffhangers: War Against the Han

64535.name: High Adventure Cliffhangers: The Buck Rogers Adventure Game

96081.name: Switching to Guns (Issue IX - Feb 2009)
96081.description:
Contents:

The fifth and final installment of the High Bridge Road adventures for my Ashford Valley Labyrinth Lord Chat game is presented below.

Looking for trouble

The tale of one sad bugbear
The bugbears former residence
Undead a go-go!

96082.name: Sentinel's Bible
96082.description:
from the back of the book

The Sentinel's Bible is a tool to aid the Chosen Elect in their battle. The pages that lie ahead shed light on the nature of the war against the Legion, and hint at the enemy's movements during the Time of Uncertainty. They introduce invaluable wisdom on what it means to be a soldier of God, and the pitfalls that the holy warrior will face along the way. The life of a Sentinel is a tragic one, and embracing this truth enhances its potential to create memorable and lasting Prophecies.

96083.name: KDice
96083.description:
KDice is a browser-based multiplayer strategy game based on Taro Ito's Dice Wars. KDice is programmed in Adobe Flash and AJAX by Ryan Dewsbury and was released in 2006. Gameplay in KDice is a simplified version of Risk with the primary goal of the game being to control every territory on the map.

Source: Wikipedia, "KDice", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96084.name: Switching to Guns (Issue X - Feb 2009)

rpgissuearticle.41248: Chicago White Sox Game Bus Disappears

96084.description:
Contents:

Late last year, I ran a Savage Worlds Slipstream/Iron Lords of Jupider–esque game for the Corvis Monkey Troupe. Here is the actual play notes from that game.

Chicago White Sox game bus disappears
Fire-breathing hydras
Space zombies and ro-kar the space dragon
Operation market garden

96086.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XI - Feb 2009)
96086.description:
Contents:

Here’s part II of the Changeling: The Dreaming Fae Portland.

A Changeling the : Dreaming chronicle

Three more major freeholds of Portland
Five minor freeholds of Portland
Four fae places in Portland
Two chimerical spots in the city

96087.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XII - Feb 2009)
96087.description:
Contents:

Returning to my Ashford Valley Labyrinth Lord setting, I’ve got another bunch of adventures for the PCs, this time all about a bunch of trouble happening along the Deep Forest Road.

The runestones of the Deep Forest

The broken runestone
Solving the mystery
Defeat the spirits of the robbers
Change out the runestone
Prevent the orcs from reaching the cave

96088.name: The Adventurer's Ordinance
96088.description:
Website blurb:
110 New Magical Items for any Setting

User summary:
Magic items usable in any D&D version. Easily adapted to any fantasy game.

96089.name: The Tome of Minor Items
96089.description:
Website blurb:
This book is packed full of minor items suitable for low-level characters or a low-magic setting.

Author's Preface:
The items in this tome are meant to be used for low level characters, or in low magic campaign worlds, after all not everyone can be favored by the gods.

Many of the items found here are weaker versions of their more powerful cousins, or replications of lower level spells. Others may have simple useful properties in combat or everyday adventuring.

These items are meant to be used in 1st edition Advanced Dungeons and Dragons, but can easily be ported into other editions.

User comment:
This supplement is available as a free download from Dragonsfoot.org

96090.name: Quest for the Moons of Krynn
96090.description:
Website blurb:
Ever wondered about the three moons of Krynn? This article takes a scientific look at the moons and their orbits.

User comment:
This supplement is available as a free download courtesy of Dragonsfoot.org

96091.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XIII - Feb 2009)
96091.description:
Contents:

This issue contains the second of five Deep Forest Road adventures for my Ashford Valley Labyrinth Lord Chat game.

Rangers of the Deep Forest

If you go out in the woods today...
Encounters in the Forest

96093.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XIV - Feb 2009)
96093.description:
Contents:

Here is the third of five Deep Forest Road adventures for my Ashford Valley Labyrinth Lord Chat game.

Workin' in a gold mine, workin' down, down...

My dwarves are not Scottish!
What's really happening
On the road again
To the manor born

96094.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XV - Feb 2009)
96094.description:
Contents:

I’ve been planning my Ashford Valley Labyrinth Lord Chat game for nearly 10 issues and here’s the latest installment of the Deep Forest Road adventures.

Roads and rumors

What the dwarf saw
The whole truth
The burial mound

96095.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XVI - Feb 2009)
96095.description:
Contents:

This is the final installment of the Deep Forest Road adventures. Don't worry, though, because there are more Ashford Valley adventures planned for the future. If you’ve used any of these adventures, I am interested in how they worked out for you, so let me know.

The meteor

The trouble with sages
Encounters in the forest

96096.name: Konterfix
96096.description:
Goal: Depends on variant you choose

Variant A:Try to get four of your pegs in a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row
Players use a 7x7 board with 25 pegs each - by turns. If a player succeeds he may
remove an opponent's peg - winner is the player who removed the most pegs

Variant B: Use a pegged board and move your pegs to get a row of 4; if you succeed you may
remove an opponent's peg It is allowed to open and close it once more (see German
checkers)

Variant C: Form two facing rows and move your (14) pegs to reach the opposite side first, you
may walk and leap (like Halma)

Variant D: - Sologame

96097.name: Tiques Attack
96097.description:
Attention owners of nice little fur balls! Ticks are here to come and bite! Will you be quick enough to protect your pet from these pests vampire? Hope you are cause Tiques Attack is a game of speed that will put all your senses to work. When you see or hear that your pet may be infected with parasites, you must react faster than ticks and expose an animal other than yours to their terrible voracity.

Warning! Ticks attack! Sharpen your reflexes and get ready for a party filled with laughter and action with Tiques Attack.

The goal of the game is to have as few as possible ticks counter at the end of the game. The player with the fewest win. To do so, you must be faster than your opponent to protect your animal by covering it with cards from your pile as your animal shows up in the danger zone. Players can also get ticks counter by making mistakes.

96098.name: Party de famille
96098.description:
Music, dance, laughter. What a mood! What a party! Here's your goal: gather as many guests as possible to your family party. Try to create that party atmosphere that only key guests can create, like Gerard and his guitar, or by combining the trainer and his animals. It would not be so difficult if it wasn't for your opponents who will do everything in their power to break your party. Party de famille is a card game with 4 players, played in teams of 2. Overall, try your luck, start your invitations for the best family party ... and let the fun begin!

This is a trick-taking card game. You must bet on how many trick-taking you can make in a round to make points. If you and your partner get it right, you get to count ambiance points, which consist of card combinations, as well as trick-taking points. If you got it wrong, your opponents get the ambiance points.

The game end when a team reaches 200 points.

96099.name: Le règne animal
96099.description:
Game # 1: Many animals roam the heart of the forest, but some are more threatening than others, like the big brown bear or the wolf. It's better to have them on your side! Each player starts the game with a number of forest animals. The goal: to get rid of them before the others. But it is not easy, especially when the killer bee or a forest fire suddenly join the game. Sauve qui peut!

Game # 2: What is that strange smell that irritates the nostrils suddenly? Skunks! But who has the skunk in his game? Each player must avoid at all costs the skunk, because those who stay with it will lose the game. Laughter guaranteed!

Game # 3: The players must try to form triples of similar animals.
The best way: go hunting!

Jeu #1 : De nombreux animaux rôdent au cœur de la forêt, mais certains sont plus menaçants que d’autres, comme le grand ours brun ou le loup. Ceux-là, mieux vaut les avoir de son côté ! Chaque joueur commence la partie avec un certain nombre d’animaux de la forêt. Le but du jeu : s’en départir avant les autres. Mais ce n’est pas facile, surtout quand l’abeille tueuse ou un feu de forêt se mettent soudainement de la partie. Sauve qui peut !

Jeu #2 : Quelle est cette étrange odeur qui irrite soudainement nos narines ? LA MOUFETTE ! Mais qui a donc la bête puante dans son jeu ? Chaque joueur doit fuir à tout prix la moufette, car celui qui restera avec elle perdra la partie. Fou rire garanti !

Jeu #3 : Les joueurs doivent tenter de former des triples d’animaux semblables.
La meilleure façon : aller à la chasse !

96100.name: Cyberlords - Arcology
96100.description:
The citizens of the Asgard Arcology are terrorized by corporate security forces. Lead the Resistance and save the world from total surveillance!

Source: The Developer Website.

96101.name: Aporkalypse - Pigs of Doom
96101.description:
The pig world is in danger! Follow the four heroes of ham through the fires of hell and use brains, brawn and bacon to stop the Aporkalypse!

Source: The Developer Website.

96102.name: Chō Aniki
96102.description:
Cho Aniki is the first game in the Cho Aniki series. It was originally released in 1992 on the PC Engine only in Japan. Years later, the game was released on the Wii's Virtual Console in Japan, North America, and Europe. This makes it the first time any game of this series has seen release outside Japan.

The game's plot, involves the heroes moving through various locations — space, urban environments, elaborate ruins — and fighting alien invaders. Bo Emperor Bill (Botei-biru, a pun of bodibil, a short of bodybuild in Japanese), the man who achieved ten consecutive victories in the Great Galaxy Bodybuilding contest, faces an ever decreasing supply of protein. He unilaterally invades neighboring star systems, in order to establish protein factories to replenish his supply. Feeling threatened, the heaven realm sent Idaten and Benten to vanquish Bo Emperor Bill. Thus the sweaty hot battle between the muscle brothers (aniki) and Builders Army begins.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cho Aniki (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96103.name: Star Parodier
96103.description:
Star Parodier is a shoot 'em up developed by Hudson Soft for the PC Engine CD-ROM. It is a parody of the Star Soldier series, similar to Konami's Parodius series, and was originally only released in Japan, though it was also intended to be released in North America under the name Fantasy Star Soldier.

The game was later released outside Japan through the Wii Virtual Console in Europe on May 16, 2008, after a re-release in its home country. It was finally released in North America on August 11, 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Parodier", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96104.name: Chaos Field
96104.description:
Chaos Field (カオスフィールド Kaosufiirudo?), released as Chaos Field New Order for the PlayStation 2, is a 2005 shoot 'em up arcade game released by Milestone Inc.. It was ported to Dreamcast, PlayStation 2, and Nintendo GameCube, the latter being the only one that had an American release, while the others remained Japan-exclusives. Additionally, it is included as part of Milestone Shooting Collection: Karous Wii.

The game follows the "boss fest" style - the levels consist of little more than battles against a single, very powerful enemy. The player's ship can move back and forth between two parallel dimensions - the "order field" and the "chaos field". In the Order Field, enemies have less firepower, whereas in the Chaos Field there are more opportunities for amassing points.

The player can choose one among three ships, each with specific traits of firepower and speed. All of them have a "sword" special power, possibly inspired by Radiant Silvergun, but here it is used just to cancel enemy shots rather than attack.

There are two special attacks that the player can use, A "Wing Layer" and a "Lock-on Shot". The Wing Layer can be used to damage the enemy as well as canceling bullets to obtain combos. The Lock-On shot targets parts of the boss or bullets. These attacks function differently for each ship.

Combos can be obtained as well. The player can generate combos by targeting bullets or sections of the enemies with the Lock-on Shot or by canceling bullets with the Wing Layer. However, it is only possible to target bullets with the Lock-On shot while in the Chaos Field.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chaos Field", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96105.name: Quad Doku
96105.description:
Quad Doku is a tile-laying word game played on a 4x4 grid with a 2x2 hole in the middle. Players take turns laying tiles with letters on them to form four 4-letter words around the frame, with the goal of making a doku, a four letter word whose points add up to 10.

The game is much like upwords, in that you can place tiles on top of the tiles already on the board, but different in that each letter is worth a number of points; sometimes the same letter has different point values on different tiles.

From the publisher:

The challenging word game of four letter words!

Play with letter tiles on a matrix of four intersecting words. the goal is simple, just form as many "dokus" (4-letter words) as you can. Score four dokus on one turn, and you've scored a perfect Quad Doku!

- Includes 75 Molded Letter Tiles
- Molded Board
- Instructions

96106.name: Beat Debt
96106.description:
Beat Debt is a financial strategy game that educates consumers about investment principles and good economic choices. Players use disposable income to purchase investments and pay off credit card debt. The first player to have $5000 put away for investments and a zero credit card balance is declared the winner.

Includes a board, six tokens, play money, dice, financial statement forms, and rules.

"Break the cycle of credit card debt in your home the fun way!"

96107.name: No Time To Explain
96107.description:
User Summary

No Time To Explain is a humorous time travel indie platformer game where your gun also serves as a means of locomotion.

96109.name: Dead Moon
96109.description:
Dead Moon​ is a video game released for the TurboGrafx-16. It was developed by T.S.S. and published by Natsume, released on February 22, 1991 in Japan and later in 1991 in North America. It is a horizontally-scrolling shooter with the player piloting a space ship in order to stop an alien infestation of the Moon. The game was released on the Nintendo Wii's Virtual Console to all regions in 2007.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dead Moon (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96110.name: Other Hands (Issue 13 - Apr 1996)
96110.description:
Previous Issue

Other Hands
Issue 13
April, 1996

Cover art by Patrick Wynne

Next Issue

96111.name: Other Hands (Issue 14 - July 1996)
96111.description:
Previous Issue

Other Hands
Issue 14
July, 1996

Cover art by Patrick Wynne

Next Issue

96112.name: Ironclaw (Revised)
96112.description:
From the back of the book:

IRONCLAW is a role-playing game set at the cusp of a change in a fantasy world's history. Dozens of different sentient races, cultures, and societies are converging upon the strategic island of Calabria. As a player, you will start with humble beginnings, only to become involved in machinations as each noble house vies for control. Which side will you take?

96113.name: Rinaldi (Revised)
96113.description:
(From the back of the book)

Through their cleverness and guile, the ancient Rinaldi made themselves the unquestioned rulers of Calabria. Their city of Triskellan became a haven of culture, technology, and commerce.

But all things change with time. Generations of misrule and neglect have reduced the once-proud bloodline to fops and schemers. Now the Guild Masters rule the city, playing each Noble House off one another for their own advantage. But the title of nobility still carries certain privileges...

(From the Title Page)

What's Changed in This Edition?

This is a reprint of Rinaldi, the first supplement for Ironclaw. The attached materials have been updated to match the latest version of the core rules. The material has been condensed to fit in this new format. Two sections were removed: the calendar (because that is included in the latest Ironclaw) and "The Closing of the City Gates" (which was expanded and presented, again, in Ironclaw). All other material is here.

96114.name: Mall Frenzy
96114.description:
DESCRIPTION:
Have you ever wanted to run your own business? Whether you want to have a coffee shop, a shoe store, or a fine art establishment..now you can do so at The Mall.

The Mall allows 2-5 players to compete for the best retail space and customers to accumulate the most money in the shortest time. Can you prove how business savvy you are?

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Have the most net worth (cash and properties) once there are not enough customers remaining at The Mall.

GAMEPLAY:
Starting with a small shop at your local mall, players upgrade as quickly as possible and expand into more shops to capture as many customer sales as possible. Action cards are used to drive customers to each of your shop(s) for maximum revenue. Marketing cards are used to strategically improve your position or slow down your competition.

As the game progresses, there are less and less customers at the mall, causing the competition to become frenzied as you push for the maximum net worth.

GAME ELEMENTS:
The Mall uses a unique card system to determine movement. No dice were harmed in the making of this game.

96115.name: Ninja Assault
96115.description:
From the back of the case:

Ruling with an army of demonic soldiers, Shogun Kigai has conquered the innocent nation of Tenshin and kidnapped its beautiful Princess Koto. As violence and carnage tear apart the land, three great Ninjas rise to end the bloodshed and rescue the Princess. Armed with sacred weapons, the three Ninjas embark on a journey to destroy the evil Shogun and defeat his menacing army of demons...

96116.name: Into The Deep (Issue 1 - Jan 2010)
96116.description:
Table of contents:

Editor's Desk

Travellers Guide: Roye

Ship's Locker: Eliminol, A Chemical Masking Agent

Construction Yard: Roye SDB

Who Are You?: Darius Chirnevenk

Featured Adventure:

Business As Usual: Vilhelm Industries, A Merchant Family Business

Bestiary: Seratis Jellyfish

Contact!: Derfi'gassak – A Xenophobic Minor Non-Human Race.

News Feed:

Featured Article: A Layman's Guide to Drive Technology

Library Data: The Nightrim Subsector

Back Page:

96117.name: Into The Deep (Issue 2 - Jun 2010)
96117.description:
Table of contents:
2, Editor's Desk

3, Travellers Guide: Zemlya - An Earth like World

10, Ship's Locker: Lethal and Non-lethal ships small arms

12, Construction Yard: Type D Frontier Trader

15, Who Are You?: Dr Jewele Andresen

18, Featured Article - The Imperial Nobility

23, Business As Usual: Medels Mega Mart - A Imperial Chain Store

24, Business As Usual: Quantum Mining Ventures - Upstart LSP Competitor

25, News Feed:

26, Bestiary: Beasts of Zemlya

28, Featured Article: Polities of Reavers' Deep

34, Library Data: The Rift Subsectors, Farift, Riftdeep, Riftrim and Gul

46, Back Page:

96118.name: Into The Deep (Issue 3 - Feb 2011)
96118.description:
Table of contents:
2, Editor's Desk

3, Travellers Guide: Khtearle - A World on the Edge

8, Ship's Locker: Medical Alert!

10, Construction Yard: Type SI Intruder Scout

13, Bestiary: Lightning Reds

14, Who Are You?: Gypsy Gengus - Rogue Extraordinaire

15, News Feed:

16, Featured Adventure: Next Lily Over

20, Business As Usual: Brandon System Company

21, Business As Usual: Banff System Company

24, Contact!: H'Oskhikhil - The Manhole Shaped Minor Non-Human Race

26, Featured Article: Standard Shipping Containers

28, Contact!: Ayansh'i – A Secretive Minor Human Race

30, Library Data: The Drinsaar Subsector

36, Back Page:

96120.name: NSKK und HJ-Verkehrsspiel
96120.description:
This pre-WWII title turned a typical traffic-rules game into a propaganda vehicle for Hitler Jugend and the NSKK (Nationalsozialistisches Kraftfahrkorps or National Socialist Motor Corps). The box cover features young men in HJ uniforms, while Wikipedia describes the latter as a small paramilitary organization within the Nazi party that both provided roadside assistance like the American Automobile Association and trained members in the operation and maintenance of motorcycles and automobiles.

The game content includes a large 33" x 24" game board, seven grey wooden non-player vehicles, six colored player vehicles and eight people figures, some pedestrian and some matched with vehicles (e.g. the red motorcycle and rider).

The combination allows for a total of nine players, five pedestrians and four vehicles. Each player gets a set of five cards: a starting location, a final destination, and three intermediate stops. The first player to complete his route while respecting all of the traffic rules wins.

96121.name: Going to the World's Fair
96121.description:
A souvenir item game promoting the 1939 New York World’s Fair.
The players visit the of the Fair attractions. The game is a simple roll and move

Content:
1 board
a box of silver coins - denominations of 5¢ (Teddy Roosevelt), 10¢ (Jefferson), 25¢ (Washington), and 50¢ (Lincoln)
4 colored wooden player pieces,
1 lead weighted metal spinner,
2 Bakelite dice,
instructions,
attractions cards.

96122.name: Argonaut
96122.description:
Website blurb:
Argonaut is an adventure intended for the Traveller RPG rule set. The characters play star-farers from a technically backward 21st century Earth thrust into the modern Traveller universe. They must fight for their survival and then cope with the culture shock of being introduce into the alien world of Traveller. The characters are crew on board on of Earth's first interstellar ships, the Argonaut. Launched in 2037 the Daedalus program is the human races first brave venture into colonisation of the universe. Unfortunately for the crew things go terribly wrong...

96123.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 26 - Mar 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96123.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

Call of Cthulhu WWI setting and adventure issue.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: Ftagnin' in the Dark
-Tribute to Gary Gygax
-Call of Cthulhu: That Terrible Old Forest House

96124.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 27 - Apr 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96124.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

The murder of Thomas A'Becket as a source of RPG inspiration.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: Sesquipedalian Amalgamate
-What I'm Reading: Grendel
-On a Late December Day
-The Four Mean Swords

96125.name: De høye landene
96125.description: De høye landene (The high lands) is one of two core books for the Lærelyst RPG for education. This book contains the fantasy setting for the Lærelyst game, in which the students must complete assignments in different subjects while defending the court of the queen, solving murder mysteries and searching the woods for the dangerous Gnorgs.

96126.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 28 - Apr 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96126.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

The Siege Perilous issue.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: Doors and Sieges
-Seattle Spots: The Somewhere Door
-Returning to d20
-The Crusades: d20 Jerusalem

96127.name: Fra Vestfold til Miklagard
96127.description: Fra Vestfold til Miklagard (From Vestfold to Miklagard)(Miklagard is an old norse name for Istanbul) is one of two core books for the Lærelyst RPG for education. This book contains the historic setting for the Lærelyst game, in which the students will complete assignments while looking for a young girl who has disappeared, fight Vikings, and go to trade in Miklagard.

96128.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 29 - May 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96128.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

Ideas from the past including an updated Sf Ice World setting and an old submission for a D&D setting.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: Ice Null and Judges
-Morrow Project Ice World Game
-Null Set: Fantasy Setting #1

96129.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 30 - May 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

rpgissuearticle.40217: Introduction: More Fun Than Is Right

96129.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

A detailed modern horror write-up, plus other campaign ideas.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: More Fun Than Is Right
-Kill with a Borrowed Sword
-Seattle's King in Yellow Cab

96131.name: The Haunted
96131.description:
Website blurb:
A follow-on scenario based on 'The Haunting' from the Call of Cthulhu rulebook. One of the winners of the 2010 YSDC Scenario Contest.

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com

96132.name: The Horror on Haldon Hill
96132.description:
Website blurb:
Some rum goings-on in the south of England. Has the Beast of Dartmoor returned? Set in the 1920s this adventure features an unusually good set of local background information

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com

96133.name: The Incriminating Letter
96133.description:
Website blurb:
A group of investigators is asked to look into a medical controversy from the past. Their investigation may lead them to New York, Mexico, and Maine. A good scenario for a party of investigators with limited experience.

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com

96134.name: The Lunatics Have Taken Over The Asylum
96134.description:
Website blurb:
You awaken to another day of misery and confusion, an inmate in the Oakengates Asylum. The prospect of further treatment at the hands of the cruel and uncaring staff terrifies you, yet there is no escape. For you the future is as bleak as the granite walls that you stare at day in, day out. There are others you call friends. All mad of course. You know you are the only really sane person in this horrific place. If only you could convince the Doctor. If only there as a way to make them listen to your tortured pleas, to make them stop, to let you out. But what hope is there... ?

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com

96135.name: Safety 1st Auto Traffic Race
96135.description:
A battery operated board game which uses the concept of a traffic light and a rondel to move diecast cars around the rectangular board.

The traffic light lights up red, yellow, or green depending on where the rondel's arrow stops. The rondel features six options for stop, go , or caution. The board is illustrated as a city block.

96136.name: Alien Outpost
96136.description:
Description: Alien Outpost is a fast paced defense game with awesome shooter gameplay mechanics! Defend your base against wave after wave of alien attackers, and manage your assets wisely as you upgrade your defenses. Alien Outpost will have you on the edge of your seat!

Features:
Innovative "shooter" control scheme
7 creative and whacky alien enemies
Upgradable weapons, bases, special weapons, and more
Changing times of day
Automatic save/load
Local scoreboard

Source: The Developer Website.

96137.name: PowerDown
96137.description:
PowerDown is inspired by the famous Lights Out puzzle game and has never looked better. Now with a completely new interface,retina HD graphics and 300 new puzzles, taking the total to 350, prepare yourself to mentally meet your match.

Features:

350 puzzles
On top of the original 50 puzzles there are now 300 new puzzles. All of these new puzzles are delivered on 6x6 grids and include not only the default light switching mode, but also a new X light mode.

OpenFeint & Gamecenter
PowerDown is OpenFeint Enabled, and GameCenter enabled with 14 achievements.

Retina HD Graphics
Not only has the interface been designed with the retina display in mind it is also had a makeover from top to bottom to bring to you the best experience possible.

Facebook
Share PowerDown with your friends and see if they can rise to the challenge

Source: The Developer Website.

96138.name: The Maze of Madness
96138.description:
Website blurb:
Medical experiments into the psychology of fear attracts unwelcome and unwholesome attention.

Excerpts from the introduction:
This scenario is set in 1925 and has a general theme of Gothic Horror, originally intended for the “Call of Cthulhu” role playing game.
...
Statistics have deliberately been held back to make the scenario as generic as possible. As the scenario was originally intended for use with “Call of Cthulhu”, it makes reference to existing material written for the game.
Such references are not essential however. A good referee should get by without them, although they will make your life easier.

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com

96139.name: The Pennywell Hangmen
96139.description:
Website blurb:
New York - the city that never sleeps, is the setting for this 1920s Call of Cthulhu scenario. Bare witness to the dark mysteries and horrifying secrets as the sinister denizens of the Big Apple bite back! Suitable for 3+ players over 4 to 5 sessions.

Website Teaser Introduction:
Christmas has come to New York and in Uptown Manhattan snow falls on carolers, singing on a corner to a gathering crowd. Children exchange volleys of snowballs as in the distance parents call them in with dusk falling.

The shadows deepen, the sewers stream and from a Harlem tenement music spills on to the streets. Across town in Hells Kitchen the restaurants are bustling, and so too are the bars & clubs south in Greenwich Village - the season of goodwill is doing brisk business.

In Times Square a mighty pine sags underneath the weight of glittering decorations and sparkling lights. Beside it a flatfoot stands guard, eyeing the warmth of the nearby taverns.

Through a bone chilling wind and across the Hudson River is Hoboken and further inland we find the sleepy village of Pennywell. After a quiet night at the ‘Crown & Cross’ the resident publican Harold Baker watches with interest the movements across the fields before him. The last of his regulars are gone and he pauses a moment, curious at the soldiers darting about in the distance. Pennywell has been home to a Barracks since the Great War and tonight all is not quiet.

The bright evening stars illuminate a commotion as the distant figures can be seen running to and fro. The publican laughs as his wife joins him - “I think the Army boys might have had one too many eggnogs, they’re running about like headless chickens”. “Surely they won’t be out training on a night like this?”

Cracks of rifle shots blow in with the freezing wind, before a terrifying scream followed by a sudden silence. “Lord in heaven”. The door is quickly shut and bolted.

The publicans wife shudders and peers through curtain into the night.

“You know what Harold, I don’t think they’re training!”

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com or the LoST Wiki. (www.wearelost.eu)

96140.name: Anger of Stick - Friend
96140.description:
Scenario:
This game which is the tale of dead friend in 'Anger of stick' is the friend edition of 'Anger of stick'.
The player has to fulfill the rescuing hostage, removal of bomb, finding PMP and other various assignments as a special agent.
In the friend edition, lots of motions and stick animation style images are applied to this game.
You can get the feeling of seeing the stick animation while playing the game.

Game Explanation:
The player has to accomplish his duties per the stages such as rescuing hostage, removal bombs and etc on the street or inside the building by killing the enemies using lots of motions & ten weapons(rifle, machine gun, knife, bat, 90mm mortar, flame thrower, etc).

Options:
Playing difficulty, Sound on/off and Blood color can be selected.

Source: The Developer Website.

96141.name: The Shaft
96141.description:
Introduction:
431 South Walnut Street has a bad reputation. One that no one knows about. Soon its history will come to fulmination when a previous tenant decides that he wants to move back in - at any cost. The Shaft is an adventure for Call of Cthulhu set in the 1920s and using the World of Darkness rules set. It is designed to bring together a new group of players in their first session and kick off a campaign.

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com and the designer's site.

rpgitemversion.93237: PDF Scan from Original Paper Source

96142.name: Spirits over Arkham
96142.description:
Website blurb:
The death of Jeremy Lombard's nephew leads the investigators into an underground criminal operation where even the villians have got more than they bargained for.

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com.

96143.name: Angry Business Man
96143.description:
Don't you hate missing the bus?
Angry Business Man sure hates it!
Help Business Man by rotating the iDevice, thus aligning the world around him so he never, ever has to run up or downhill. Because if there is one thing he hates more than missing busses, it's running.

Source: The Developer Website.

96144.name: Turn to Stone
96144.description:
Website blurb:
A Classic-era adventure set in Iceland. With a brief source book on what to expect in Iceland. Face the horror of the Third Cloister!

Introduction:
Turn to Stone is a Classic-era scenario for Call of Cthulhu, set in late 1920s rural Iceland. It is appended to the events of Home, Sweet Home, published in the Chaosium monograph The Primal State, but can be played alone. The necessary background and concepts from Home, Sweet Home are repeated and expanded upon here.

User comment:
This adventure is available as a free download from Yog-sothoth.com

96145.name: Army Lines
96145.description:
User Summary

In Army Lines, you send your allied troops out with the goal to defeat the nazis on the other side of the battle. Your troops start in one side of the screen, and must run towards the other side, where the enemy is spawning his troops that run towards you.

As the game progresses, you will gain acces to more troops (8 kinds in total) and upgrade your 4 special weapons.

96146.name: Feats of Psionic Might
96146.description:
From the publisher's website:

Compatible with Psionics Unleased from Dreamscarred Press! Dreamscarred’s excellent psionics system puts psionics back on par with conventional character types in the Pathfinder game. The Genius Guide to Feats of Psionic Might opens up a range of great new options for characters using these rules. With three dozen new feats, this book is a must-have for any psionic character looking to unlock the full potential of his or her mind.

96147.name: Bowman Attack
96147.description:
User Summary

In Bowman Attack you control a character fighting a string of other characters. All of you will be using bows to shoot at each other.

As the game progresses, you will level up and gain money to be used for buying special weapons to use against your foes.

96149.name: Attack Balls
96149.description:
User Summary

Attack Balls is a classic arcade game. In this game, you have rows of coloured balls on the top of the screen. On the bottom, you have single balls of different colours.

The goal of the game is to fling these single balls up towards the groups of balls, hitting the balls on top with balls of the same colour, thus making them disappear. You lose if the balls from the top reach the bottom.

96151.name: Simbad il Marinaio
96151.description:
user summary

"This is Sinbad the sailor smart and brave adventurer out the stories of the beautiful Scheherazade, the queen of the Arabian Nights!"

The series consists of a single volume, has not had great success in their homeland.
Gaming system. Simbad has two canonical characteristics (ability and vitality). The fighting takes place by rolling the dice and causing scores of attack and defense and their opponents. Particular the possibility of a real "naval battle", even with simplified mechanism."

96152.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Darkness envelops the world; chaos reigns. Humanity fights back in the only way they know how -- with forceful control. But how does one control creatures whose existence defies all logic?

Nightfall: Martial Law is a stand-alone game that can be integrated with the hit competitive deck-building game Nightfall. Martial Law brings you a complete new set of cards with special powers, and features all-new vampires, werewolves, hunters and ghouls. Martial Law also introduces the feeding mechanism: Feed your chained orders to give them greater effect!

Each card has a main color and two linking colors. If you can match the main color of a card to one of the linking colors of the previous card, you can chain those cards together. Once a chain is started, players all get an opportunity to link additional cards onto the chain during that turn.

Cards in the chain resolve in reverse order: first in, last out. Instant effects fire off as cards come off the chain, doing damage to your opponents or bringing characters into play to defend you and attack your opponents.

The object of Nightfall is to put wounds into your opponents’ decks and end the game with the least amount of wounds in your deck. But beware: the more wounds a person has, the more enraged they become and the faster their deck works, meaning more cards and bigger chains will come your way!
96152.name: Nightfall: Martial Law

96153.name: Nintendo 3DS
96153.description:
The Nintendo 3DS is a portable game console produced by Nintendo, first released on February 26, 2011. A distinguishing feature of the system is its ability to produce "3D effects without the need for any special glasses" via a process called autostereoscopy. The device was released in Japan on February 26, 2011, Europe on March 25, 2011, North America on March 27, 2011 and Australia on March 31, 2011. The 3DS succeeds the Nintendo DS series of handheld systems, which primarily shares the handheld console market with Sony's PlayStation Portable. The Nintendo 3DS features backward compatibility with Nintendo DS series software, including Nintendo DSi software.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nintendo 3DS", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

96154.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 31 - Jun 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96154.description:
From website:

A Supers in Space Genre Mash (Babylon 5 and Godlike RPG), another ancient Chinese tactic plus info on Orbital Mind Control Lasers.

From Introduction:

Thirty one issues of my 'zine! That’s simply amazing! I’m pretty proud of that (and they’ve been mostly on–time, too)! This issue, I've got some fun stuff, from one of my genre–mixes (Supers in Space!) to another good tactic from China. And if you get “instructions” to game with your friends, don’t blame me!

96155.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 32 - Jun 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96155.description:
From website:

Notes on my Call of Cthulhu WWI game, the Crackpot Index and a new PA game.

From Introduction:

Sorry, folks, for the lateness of the issue. As I've mentioned before, I work full time and attend graduate school for a Masters Degree in Engineering. Spring quarter, my class really poured it on for the last few weeks. I just received my grade: an A (GPA 3.8)! Go me! And the professor said that I had the highest grade in the class for people taking the class for credit.

96156.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 2, Issue 33 - Jul 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

96156.description:
From website:

A espionage campaign set-up, another Chinese strategy and a new quote.

From Introduction:

July has come and so I present a quick campaign write–up on an espionage game that was prompted by a recent book I've been reading. Also, included is another Chinese strategy and a quote of the month, this one by a French political economist. Also, I found a website with de–classified government documents. Tré cool!

boardgameimplementation.120669: No Retreat! The North African Front

96157.description:
The African Front: 1940 - 1942

Deluxe Series #5

Following on the success of No Retreat! where the Russian Front of World War II beckons, game designer Carl Paradis and his trusty developer Alan Emrich have teamed up again to present the second chapter in this game series, No Retreat 2: North Africa, this time taking the action to the African Front from the start of Operation Compass on 8 December 1940, through 1942 to the eviction of the Axis from Libya.

Building on the notion of a card assisted game and death-or-glory victory conditions, No Retreat 2 offers a narrative game rich in the feel for the ebb-and-flow of the campaign, wrapped around an exciting maneuver and combat system that harks back to the glory days of classic wargaming but includes all the modern features and plenty of innovations. Unlike other North Africa wargames, there are 5 mini-maps located at the various termini of maneuver in the campaign, and where battles are waged as fascinating mini-games in their own right. Players try to sweep each map and force the action onto the next one in an effort to push their opponent out of the game.

The looming Malta factor is accounted for most assiduously. While abstracted into many aspects of the game, players must always be mindful of Malta being made active (helping the Allies) or inactive (assisting the Axis). The Italian forces have their rightful place in the story unfolding on the game board, and the remarkable paucity of units turns every counter and hex into the kind of wargaming puzzle reminiscent of the glory days of those great contests from the Avalon Hill General magazine.

The use of Supply Point markers, received in a fast, hassle-free way, to seize the initiative, replace losses and recover shattered formations, to light up a map and begin operations there (i.e., conduct player turns on it of maneuver and combat), and then to continue those player turns for another round. Each additional round of player turns must be paid for by another Supply Point, usually spent by the side that feels it is advantageous to press on and keep the opponent hard pressed, recreating simply and effectively the lulls and starts in battlefield operations that were a signature of this campaign.

The desert lies before you and World War II is at stake. You must endure and prevail under the most surprising and grueling of circumstances, for there is No Retreat!

Game Data:

Number of Players: 2
Ages: 14 and up
Playing Time: approximately 50 minutes for each scenario; 3 to 4 hours for a campaign game
Complexity: 5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: German & Allied units are Divisions (8-10,000 men), Italian units are Corps of binary (2 Regiment) Divisions; each hex is 10 miles across, and each turn is 1-2 months of real time.

Game Components:


12 page color Rules booklet
4 page Scenarios booklet
One 11" x 25.5" 2-sided color map sheet containing five mini maps
One 8.5" x 11" Player Aid mat
Two 8.5" x 5.5" Player Aid sheets
48 color, 5/8" two-sided square game unit counters
56 color, 5/8" two-sided round game markers
36 Event cards
Polybag packaging and component storage
96157.name: No Retreat 2

96158.description:
Publisher Blurb:
